And then there’s the mind-blowing scenery of the Ngorongoro Crater, formed when a volcano erupted leaving fertile plains in its place.

The tour finishes with three days on the tropical beaches of Zanzibar, where you can sail in a dhow, go snorkelling and feast on fresh seafood.

dayInfo.description: Begin your adventure in Nairobi, the capital and largest city in Kenya. There are no activities planned, so relax and settle into Nairobi life. Around 6pm say jambo to your tour leader and fellow travellers, when we gather as a group for the first time to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. Your tour leader then ensures a big Kenyan welcome by arranging a group dinner. Want to explore further? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: Heron Portico Hotel (or similar)

We travel west into the Great Rift Valley to the lakeside town of Naivasha. This is a lovely scenic route that takes us to Naivasha, which is where we stay for the night. While the crew set up the camp, you can enjoy a boat ride, where you have the chance to spot some of beautiful birdlife and elusive hippos. Accommodation: Crescent Campsite, Oloiden Camp (or similar) - full-service camping

This morning, we drive to Lake Nakuru National Park, where we enjoy a superb game drive. Although small, the park is home to an amazing variety of animals and birdlife. It also has a soda lake, which is sometimes home to thousands of flamingos. We hope to see endangered white and black rhinos, lions and, if we are very lucky, the elusive leopard. There is a stunning view above the lake from Baboon Cliffs and here we may see a rock hyrax, a small, furry relative of the elephant. Tonight, we stay just outside the park in a campsite with good showers and flush toilets. Accommodation: Nderit Campsite or similar (full-service camping)

Today we travel into the Masai Mara, one of the most famous ecosystems in the world. This vast grassland is teeming with life; plains game including wildebeest, gazelle, topis, zebras and buffalos, and never far away are the predators: cheetahs, lions and hyenas. Between mid-August and late October, one of the greatest spectacles on Earth takes place in the Mara – the annual migration of thousands of wildebeest, gazelles and zebras. Nothing is guaranteed on safari but, with the help of our brilliant guides, you should see and learn a huge amount about the resident wildlife as we game drive through the park this afternoon. We stay in a campsite just outside the reserve for the next two nights. Accommodation: Mara Springs Camp or similar (full-service camping)

We have a full-day game drive in the Masai Mara to increase our chances of encountering many of the wildlife species in the reserve. We find a quiet spot inside the park to enjoy lunch by our vehicle, looking across the plains. There are also several optional excursions you can enjoy today in addition to the game drive, including visiting a traditional Maasai village to meet the residents. Accommodation: Mara Springs Camp or similar (full-service camping)

Our long drive today is up through the Western Highlands and allows plenty of time to appreciate the superb scenery. The road begins to descend and we leave the neatly ordered rows of tea bushes as we cross into Tanzania at the Sirari/Isebania Border. We camp in a pleasant spot at Musoma on the shore of Lake Victoria. Accommodation: Matvilla Beach Lodge & Campsite or similar (full-service camping)

Today, we turn east and enter the vast Serengeti Plain, one of the largest parks in Africa. There is a choice of routes into the Serengeti, depending on the weather: if it is dry, the 80mi (130km) Western Corridor is open and usually full of plains game. If it is wet, however, this road, which is built on black cotton soil, is impassible and we must enter the park from the north at Ndabaka gate. We spend two nights in the park so we have plenty of time to enjoy the vast open spaces and the variety of game. We camp at Seronera, where there are various camping areas, all in open bush with no fences to prevent the animals from visiting during the night. A real taste of wild Africa! Accommodation: Serengeti Public Campsite or similar (full-service camping)

We leave early and it is often possible to watch elephants and other animals browsing close to the campsite. The morning is spent game driving in the eastern part of the park, where it is unusual not to spot a pride of lions in their favourite place: under a big, shady tree. After crossing the vast grasslands, we come to the Ngorongoro entry gate at Naabi Hill. We travel up towards the edge of the Ngorongoro Crater, the wide-open plains below stretching as far as the eye can see. Finally reaching the top, the crater opens in front of us: a huge, natural caldera, one of the great sights of Africa. The Ngorongoro Crater is the largest unbroken caldera in the world, formed when a volcano top erupts, leaving fertile plains in its place. Before this happened, it was the highest mountain in Africa, towering over nearby Kilimanjaro. The crater is essentially made of grassy plains, lush forest and a soda lake, which houses flamingos and an array of birdlife. From the rim, at an altitude of 7,875ft (2,400m), the cliff plunges down some 1,970ft (600m) to the crater floor with a whole host of extinct volcanoes ringing the valley. Our campsite here is very basic and can be very cold at night, so please come prepared. Accommodation: Simba Campsite or similar (full-service camping)

We descend to the crater floor in 4x4 vehicles and spend the morning watching large numbers of plains game, and the ever-present predators around them. We search for hippos in the murky pools and try to protect our food at lunchtime from the fearless brown kites, as they swoop and snatch anything that appears to be edible. After a fantastic morning, we continue our journey to the edge of the Rift Valley, where there is a great view over Lake Manyara (often tinted pink around the edges from large numbers of flamingos) and to Arusha. Accommodation: Njiro Legacy or similar (full-service camping)

We take a morning flight to Zanzibar, an island 22mi (35km) from the mainland. First visited by Arab traders in the eighth century, and countless travellers in the following centuries, it is most famous for its spices and was once the centre of the East African slave trade. We spend our first night in Stone Town and then two nights by the beach. Stone Town is a myriad of small alleys and markets. We recommend a spice tour around the island plantations with chances to taste and buy. Accommodation: Tembo Hotel/Mizingani Hotel (or similar)

After a free morning in Stone Town, we transfer to our hotel by the beach. There is plenty to occupy your days here. You can relax on the eastern and northern beaches, with excellent snorkelling, sailing in a dhow and plenty of fresh seafood. The local buses are efficient and enable you to travel all over the island, although hiring a 4x4 for a day or two is a more exciting way of getting about and not expensive. It’s a fascinating mixture of culture, history and wonderful beaches. Accommodation: Mnarani Beach Cottages / Sunset bungalows (or similar)
Our adventure ends after breakfast and we begin our return journeys home. If you’d like more time to explore, speak to your sales representative about extending your stay.

tourName: Kenya and Tanzania safari highlights, incl Zanzibar
generalInfo: The perfect introduction to Tanzania & Kenya. Featuring Kenya’s finest national parks: Maasai Mara and Lake Nakuru, as well as Tanzania’s northern circuit. This safari includes popular highlights and hidden gems found along the famous route. Starting in Nakuru National Park and the Maasai Mara, you’ll also visit Lake Victoria, Ngorongoro Crater, Tarangire National Park and the Serengeti.

dayInfo.description: After an early morning pick-up from Jomo Kenyata international airport, you will drive to Lake Nakuru National Park. Lake Nakuru lies across the equator and southward of Bogoria in the Great Rift Valley. It is known worldwide for its flamingos and is recognized as one of the world’s natural wonders. Lake Nakuru is also a rhino sanctuary, harbouring a population of over 40 black and over 60 white rhinos. The flamingos, of course, have always been the main attraction. There may be almost two million flamingos in residence at any given time, forming a stunningly beautiful deep pink band around the edge of the lakeshore. You will arrive in time for lunch and an afternoon game drive.

After breakfast drive to Masai Mara National Reserve. This is one of the few places left on earth where wildlife still lives comparatively undisturbed in the numbers that were once common across all the plains and forests of Africa. As the northern tip of the vast Serengeti ecosystem, the Mara hosts the spectacular seasonal migration of thousands of wildebeest, zebras, and attendant predators. You will arrive in time for lunch, followed by an afternoon game drive.

After breakfast, a full-day game drive in the Masai Mara (lunch will be a picnic). The reserve is well known for its black-maned lions and abundant wildlife. This is one of the few places where it’s possible to see the big five during a morning game drive. Many cheetahs are so tame that they seek shelter from the hot sun under vehicles. Several climbs onto the roof to get a better view of prospective prey! For bird enthusiasts – almost 500 species have been recorded here. Among these include 16 species of eagle, many hawks, and falcons, six species of vultures, eight species of storks, four species of bustard (including the Kori bustard, the world’s heaviest flying bird), and nine species of sunbirds.

Today after breakfast you will be transferred from Masai Mara kenya to the boarder with Tanzania Isebania. upon arrival and M&G with your Tanzanian driver guide you will be transferred to Lake Victoria for leisure.

Today after breakfast you will be at leisure. Ocasionaly the Lake Victoria water rise for a period and this water-based camp suddenly is full of Tilapia fish and hippo under walkways. Cultural visits to nearby fishing village can be taken from the camp returning by boat via the fabulous Little Okavango Tower where you can enjoy brunch and a relax whilst in the views.

Today after breakfast drive to Serengeti National Park for the game drive. The name Serengeti came from Maasai word which means the “plains with no end”. Enjoy the amazing landscape from the sea of the waving grass dotted with acacia and marula trees to the water points where there is always drama between herbivorous and predators. Arrive at your tented camp in the evening.

Today Start your day with an early Morning game drive. As you drive through the the hillside, the vast Serengeti spreads out before you as far as the eyes can see. This 6,900 sq. mile (18,000 sq. km) park is inhabited by more than two million large animals, including more than a million wildebeest, hundreds of thousands of plains zebras, and Thomson’s gazelles. Large predators, including lions, cheetahs, and hyenas, are drawn to the area by the abundance of prey that migrates throughout the park. Return to your camp in the afternoon for lunch and proceed with an evening game drive later.

Today you will have a full day game drive in Serengeti with an optional of flying with a hot air balloon. Depend on your preference you can do the full day game drive or return to your camp in the afternoon for the hot lunch and proceed with the game drive later.

Today after an early breakfast head off to Ngorongoro Crater for the crater tour. Just 10 miles wide, Ngorongoro Crater was formed from a collapsed volcano. It is now a self-sustaining ecosystem with the densest predator population in Africa – you may be able to spot the Big 5 in a single afternoon!

Today after breakfast, drive to lake Manyara National Park, the park known for it’s tree-climbing lions. It’s been suggested that this unusual behavior's probably started during a fly epidemic when the cats climbed high to escape the swarms of biting flies on the ground, so present ongoing behavior is now part of their collective memory. Lake Manyara National Park is small, stretching only some 330 square km (127 square miles) along the base of the escarpment, with two thirds of it’s surface taken up by shallow alkaline Lake Manyara. Late on drive to your lodge Manyara’s secrets for leisure and overnight.
Today after your breakfast transfer to Arusha airport for your flight to Zanzibar Island. Upon arrival in Zanzibar meet and greet and transfer to a beach hotel.

You will have four full days to do exactly what you want – or as little as you want. After all, you can simply relax by your hotel pool or down on the beach, perhaps under a swaying palm tree. If a day of total inactivity is not your thing, you can swim or take advantage of one of the activities on offer via your hotel reception. Optional Island Activities.

Today enjoy the breakfast at your hotel, transfer to Stone town, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Over the centuries, many cultures have left their impressions on Zanzibar and it is perhaps in Stone Town where you can most easily see their influences.Your guide will lead you first to the colourful market, awash with exotic smells and buzzing with bartering locals. Afterwards, you will visit the calm of the 19th century cathedral, built on the former site of the slave market after the 1873 abolition of slavery. As you wander the narrow streets and alleys, you will pass the Arab houses with their inner courtyards, hidden behind heavy doors. You can compare their style with the Indian residences, adorned with balustrades and metal railings.
Today is the last day of this great trip of your life time ,you'll transfer to Zanzibar aiport for your flight back home. Karibu sana

tourName: Kenya and Tanzania safari holiday
generalInfo:
Travel through some of East Africa's best wildlife watching and safari destinations on this comprehensive three week safari which explores no less than 12 reserves and national parks and aims to showcase the very best of the natural world.

Introduction:

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife tours in Eastern Africa which combine various different wildlife watching activities. In order to develop our unrivalled range of combined wildlife watching holidays, our guides and colleagues around the world have spent years searching out the world’s best wildlife watching locations as well as visiting some seldom visited areas. This dedication has led us to create this comprehensive safari which visits nearly all of the important wildlife watching locations within both Kenya and Tanzania.

By visiting the arid ecosystems of Samburu as well as the Afro-montane habitats of Sweetwaters Game Reserve, Mt Suswa we combine unusual habitats with the more well known African safari areas such as Ngorogoro, Serengeti, the Mara and diverse lakes such as Naivasha and Magadi. No other East African safari visits the range of locations and offers the levels of diversity that you can see on this trip.

All of our tours are guided by our own professional zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) so you are sure to be in the best hands possible for the best sightings as well as a great network of local guides in East Africa who have developed a great range of wildlife watching locations where the rarest species are commonly seen. Also to try and make sure that we will see as many of the rarer and elusive animals such as striped hyenas in Sumburu and specialist species in the Afro-montane parks. On this trip we will spend many hours during the early morning and late afternoon on jeep safaris and also after dark each night we will head out with high powered spotlights and start the search for nocturnal species.

One of the reasons why our wildlife watching holidays are unique is that our background (as a company) is from a scientific and zoological standpoint and so have a great network of colleagues and contacts all over the world who are the people on the front line in search of the best new locations for wildlife watching. All of these reasons and many more make us experts in arranging safaris and are able to tailor a safari to any location to try to find your targeted species. All you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go to try and find rare and elusive species.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner (where mentioned in the itinerary)). There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and open top 4x4 vehicles for all safaris. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) will escort you on all your excursions and also very knowledgeable English speaking local guides who have decades of experience working and guiding throughout Eastern Africa. Your zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) escort is an expert in mammal biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge of where some of the most elusive African animals are; as well as having years of experience in bringing people out to see Africa’s big five and its hundreds of other species safely. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, spotlighting drives, cultural performances, cultural activities, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the African bush or some other wildlife watching activity. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour.

Seasons:

We recommend September as a great time for this trip as the wildlife is abundant at this time of year and the weather is not too hot and drier than other times of year. But we can run the trip at other times of year; just note that the price quoted here is based on the low season, we can and do run this tour at other times of year, the wildebeest migration can also be included, please ask for specific quotes for different times of the year.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by a zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) as well as local naturalist guides, drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can offer you spotlighting trips around some of the many conservancies in the southern Rift Valley so that you can search for the rarer species and other nocturnal wildlife when they are more active. These conservancies are community projects which increase income to the local community whilst preserving the natural ecosystem.
• We can also bring thermal imaging and night vision equipment as well as spotting scopes (on request) to also aid in finding the nocturnal mammals after dark and scan the horizon for harder to see species.
• We use camera traps (where available) which will increase the chances of getting close up pictures and movies of rare animals and other rare nocturnal wildlife.
• Explore a huge ranger of ecosystems and protected areas across two of the world's greatest wildlife watching destinations.
• Immerse yourself into the wonderful life of the Maasai and see how their famous coloured beads are made and also see how they and their cattle interact and live alongside the wildlife of the African plains and valleys.
• All the above reasons give this East African safari holiday a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here.
• We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Eastern Africa so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the Big Five, gorillas, chimpanzees and hundreds of other species throughout Eastern Africa. Whether it is the Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda or Rwanda or any of the other many wildlife watching locations you want to visit we can arrange it. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour travels to Samburu National Reserve, Sweetwaters Game Reserve, Lake Nakuru National Park, Lake Naivasha, Mt. Suswa, Amboseli National Park, Maasai Mara Game Reserve, Lake Magadi, conservancies in the southern Rift Valley, Ngorogoro Crater National Park and Serengeti National Park.

Fitness Level:

The majority of wildlife watching is all done from the 4x4 safari vehicle so any fitness level can participate. There are very few walks involved and all do not require any special physical fitness.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old.

dayInfo.description: Samburu National Reserve - On your arrival into the capital of Kenya, Nairobi, you will be met by your local guide and transferred to Samburu National Reserve (6 hours). This reserve is in a very arid region north of Mt Kenya and whilst being a relatively small park, the rugged landscapes is home to species such as lion, cheetah, leopards, elephants, buffalo, hippo and lots more grazing animals. You will lunch at your accommodation on arrival and have an afternoon game drive here and your evening meal back the lodge. (lunch and dinner only)

Samburu National Reserve - Today you will have a morning and afternoon safari drive into the reserve. The aim during these safaris you will should see all the usual wildlife as well as some rarer species which are common here but seldom seen anywhere else such as Beisa oryx, gerenuk, Grevy’s zebra reticulated giraffes and the blue-shanked Somali ostrich. You will return to the lodge in between safaris for lunch. (breakfast, lunch and dinner)

Sweetwaters Game Reserve - After breakfast you will leave Samburu and depart for Sweetwaters Game Reserve along the lower slopes of Mt Kenya. This private ranch has beautiful views of the snow capped Mt Kenya. After lunch you will explore the reserve in the afternoon. This private reserve is a big five reserve and is located nearby to Kenya's only chimpanzee sanctuary. Night drives and a floodlit waterhole also mean that wildlife watching can continue after dark. (breakfast, lunch and dinner)

Lake Nakuru National Park - This morning you will be driven down to the floor of the Great Rift Valley and to the stunning Lake Nakuru National Park (3 hours). On the way to Lake Nakuru you will visit Nyahururu Thompson Falls en-route. After arriving at Lake Nakuru you will have lunch and then an afternoon game drive. The major focus here is the huge colony of flamingos (around 1.5 million individuals) and another 400 plus species of birds. There are also many Rothschilds giraffes, as well as both black and white rhinos, waterbuck, reedbucks, lions, buffalo, leopard, baboons and many others which are regularly seen. (breakfast, lunch and dinner).

Maasai Mara - This morning you will have breakfast and then depart to transfer further along the Rift Valley to the world famous Maasai Mara Game Reserve (6 hours). This savanna mosaic habitat offers ideal game viewing and photographic opportunities for any wildlife enthusiasts. You will lunch at the Sarova Mara Tenetd Camp and continue the game drive to your accommodation. (breakfast, lunch and dinner).

Lake Naivasha - This morning you will be transferred to Lake Naivasha where you will have lunch at your accommodation before heading to Crescent Island on Lake Naivasha. This island is special because it is devoid of predators which enables you to experience a walking safari amid the wild animals of the island. You could get up close to many species including giraffe, eland, zebra, buffalo and numerous antelope and gazelle species. (breakfast, lunch and dinner)

Mt Suswa - After breakfast you will be transferred to the nearby Mt Suswa. You will have a packed lunch as you will be guided into the heart of the cave systems here. Mt Suswa is world renowned for its complex of caves carved out by lava in a distance past. They are considered to be the worlds most complex briaded system of lava tubes and of the 70 plus lava tubes and today we will visit 2 or 3 of these lava tubes. The experience is magical and a must for all adventurers and holiday makers wanting to experience different things. Afterwards you will spend the rest of the day hiking on the carter of Mt Suswa, this is one of the most unique volcanoes in the world as the entire 11km diameter the remnant island is completely surrounded by a 60m deep collapse-ring. You will hike to the highest peak (3 hours) and the views over the surrounding country is out of this world and well worth it. Afterwards in the early evening you will be taken to Nairobi (2 hours) and your hotel for a good night's rest. (breakfast and lunch)

Lake Magadi - This morning you will carry on your safari through Kenya towards Lake Magadi (4 hours) in the South Rift region whilst enjoying the magnificent scenery of the Great Rift Valley. A visit to Lake Magadi to see the huge flocks of flamingos, pelicans and numerous other bird species on the lake edge. If you want, with prior arrangement, we can meet with Magadi Soda Company (Africa's largest soda ash manufacturer). After the lake you will be transferred to the lodge for the evening. (breakfast, lunch and dinner).

Amboseli National Park - This morning after breakfast you will be transferred south to the world famous Amboseli National Park. Amboseli lies at the foot of the iconic Mt Kilimanjaro and there around 50 species of mammal found in the park and the most conspicuous being the huge herds of elephants which dominate the park nearly as much as Mt Kilimanjaro. On arrival you will have lunch and then enjoy a safari in the afternoon. (breakfast, lunch and dinner)
Amboseli National Park - Today will be a full day safari in the park. (breakfast, lunch and dinner)

Lake Manyara (Tanzania) - After breakfast you will leave Amboseli and head to the border town of Namanga. After the immigration formalities when crossing over into Tanzania you will also change vehicles and local guides and proceed to Arusha for lunch at the Naura Springs Hotel. After lunch you will continue to Lake Manyara (3 hours) and your accommodation on the Mto Wa Mbu escarpment, overlooking the Great Rift Valley and the stunning soda lake. You will have your evening meal here watching the sunset in spectacular settings. (breakfast, lunch and dinner)

Serengeti National Park (Tanzania) - After an early breakfast this morning you will have a morning safari before leaving for the world famous Serengeti national park as some rarer species can be seen such as pangolins, aardvarks, civet as well as more common African mammals like zebra, giraffe and hippos but the stars of the show are the unusual tree-climbing lions. After getting to the Serengeti National Park you will have a game drive. (breakfast, lunch and dinner)

Serengeti National Park (Tanzania) - Today you can either have the traditional morning and afternoon drive grames and come back to the accommodation for lunch and a midday break or head out all day with a packed lunch. The full day is of course recommended as the park is so vast and there are so many hidden gems that the most time spent here the better really. The reason for this park being so special is that the ecosystem here supports the largest remaining concentrations of game in all of Africa and the huge open spaces leave the animals free for migrations. You will return to the lodge for your evening meal.

Ngorogoro Crater - After a final game drive in the Serengeti you will then leave for Ngorogoro Crater. Along the way you will have a stop at Olduvai Gorge to visit the museum before reaching your next lodge. The lodge is built into the rim of the dormant and collapsed volcano and provides spectacular views of the crater.

Nogorogoro Crater - Today is a full day in the crater and after breakfast you will descend down into the crater. The crater is home to nearly all (barring impala, giraffe and topi) East Africa's plains mammals. There are also hundreds of species of birds and the general wildlife viewing is truly exceptional. The endangered black rhino is a particular delight to find and watch and there is nowhere better to try and see a hunt as the crater is home to Africa's densest concentration of predators. The one strange feature of the animals here is that the majority of the elephants seem to be bulls. You will return to your accommodation.

This morning you will be transferred from your lodge in the crater and travel to Arusha for lunch at Naura Springs Hotel. From here you will either be assisted to board a shuttle back to Nairobi Airport or a transfer to Kilimanjaro Airport to catch your return flight home.

tourName: Kenya and Tanzania small group safari holiday
generalInfo: Visit all the famous landmarks of East Africa on this scheduled small group tour. With 2 versions departing on a Sunday each week, this tour is guaranteed to run with a minimum of 2 clients, maximum of 6 per vehicle (subject to camp and lodge availability).  Trip can also be taken on a privately guided basis.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival into Nairobi, you will be met and transferred to your Nairobi hotel. Afternoon at leisure. Overnight on bed and breakfast basis

Leaving Nairobi after breakfast, you make your way toward the Masai Mara, watching the scenery transform from fertile highlands to the wide, open plains that announce your arrival in big-game country. As you descend into the Rift Valley and continue across the landscape, the terrain becomes increasingly wild, and early wildlife sightings often begin before you even reach the reserve—a hint of the safari excitement ahead. Arriving in time for lunch, you settle in before heading out on your first afternoon game drive. This is one of the most rewarding times to explore the Mara, as animals become more active in the cooler hours. Your safari begins with classic sights of the region: elephants moving slowly through the grasslands, giraffes silhouetted against the sky, and large herds of zebra and antelope scattered across the savannah. Predators such as lions and cheetahs may be spotted preparing for their evening activities, while hyenas patrol the plains in search of opportunity. Birdlife adds to the spectacle, with secretary birds striding through the grass and raptors soaring overhead. As the sun begins to set, the Mara transforms into a golden, peaceful expanse. You return to the lodge at dusk, ready for dinner and the promise of even more extraordinary wildlife encounters in the days ahead.

After an early breakfast, set out on a morning game drive, exploring the wildlife-rich landscapes of the reserve. The cooler hours of the morning are ideal for spotting active animals, from grazing antelope and zebras to majestic elephants and lions resting in the shade. Your guide will point out tracks, behaviours, and hidden wildlife, offering insight into the park’s dynamic ecosystem. Return to the lodge or camp in time for a relaxing lunch and some downtime, allowing you to recharge for the afternoon’s adventures. In the late afternoon, head out for a second game drive, when predators become more active and the golden light of the setting sun enhances the scenery. The interplay of wildlife, light, and landscape creates perfect conditions for photography and immersive wildlife observation. After the drive, return to your accommodation to unwind, enjoy dinner, and reflect on the day’s encounters. Overnight at the lodge or camp on a full board basis.

After breakfast, depart the Masai Mara and journey through Kenya’s fertile “breadbasket,” passing expansive wheat and barley fields before reaching Narok, the district center of this part of Maasailand. Continue across the Rift Valley plains, scanning for wildlife along the way—giraffes browsing treetops, herds of gazelle grazing, and perhaps ostriches striding across the open savannah. Ascend toward Mai-Mahiu and arrive at Lake Nakuru National Park around midday. Enter the park with wildlife viewing en route to your lodge, where lunch awaits, followed by some rest. In the afternoon, set out for a game drive across the park’s varied habitats, including woodlands, grasslands, and the lakeshore. Lake Nakuru is world-famous for its vast flocks of flamingos that sometimes turn the water pink, while hippos wallow in the shallows. The park is also home to both Black and White rhinos, elusive leopards, lions, and the endangered Rothschild’s giraffe. Antelope species, buffalo, and baboons add to the wildlife richness, creating endless photographic opportunities. Return to the lodge at sunset, reflecting on a day filled with Kenya’s remarkable biodiversity. Overnight at the lodge or camp on a full board basis.

After an early breakfast, drive to Lake Naivasha for a scenic boat ride, spotting hippos, fish eagles, and other waterbirds while enjoying the tranquil lakeshore. Afterward, leave the Rift Valley behind and continue toward Nairobi for an early lunch or picnic, depending on road conditions. Following lunch, travel south across the plains toward Amboseli National Park, arriving at your lodge by late afternoon. Set against the dramatic backdrop of Mount Kilimanjaro, Amboseli is renowned for its large elephant herds, which often move gracefully across open plains. Lions, giraffes, zebras, and a variety of antelope species also roam the park, while the wetlands and swamps attract diverse birdlife. Enjoy the iconic views and the sounds of the bush as you relax after your journey. Take in the changing light over the savannah and prepare for the game drives that await the following day. Overnight at the lodge or camp on a full board basis.

After a hearty breakfast, depart the lodge for an exhilarating full-day safari across Amboseli National Park. Explore open plains, acacia woodlands, and swamps in search of majestic elephant herds, lions, giraffes, zebras, and a variety of antelope. Pause at a scenic picnic site in the bush for lunch, surrounded by the sights and sounds of Africa’s wilderness. The afternoon continues with more game viewing as wildlife activity shifts with the changing light, offering spectacular photographic opportunities and close encounters. Return to the lodge by late afternoon, reflecting on the day’s unforgettable safari experiences and the stunning landscapes of Amboseli. Overnight at the lodge or camp in Amboseli on a full board basis.

After an early breakfast, enjoy your last views of Mount Kilimanjaro before departing Amboseli. Travel by road to the Namanga border, where you bid farewell to your Kenyan driver/guide and any travelers returning to Nairobi. Cross into Tanzania and meet your local driver for the journey to Arusha, stopping for lunch (drinks not included). In Arusha, join any new travelers before continuing toward Tarangire National Park. As you enter Tarangire, the scenery shifts to vast savannahs dotted with iconic baobab trees and seasonal rivers. The park is renowned for its large elephant herds, diverse wildlife, and rich birdlife, offering your first glimpse of the animals that make this park so special. Along the way to the lodge, watch for giraffes, zebras, and antelope, and possibly lions or leopards resting in the shade. Arrive at the lodge in the late afternoon, unwind in the peaceful bush surroundings, and enjoy dinner, ready for a full day of safari adventures tomorrow. Accommodation: lodge in Tarangire, full board.

Start the day with an early morning game drive in Tarangire National Park, when the bush comes alive with activity. Traverse open savannahs, riverine corridors, and acacia woodlands, encountering large herds of elephants moving gracefully across the plains. Spot lions lounging in the shade, leopards slipping silently through the trees, and giraffes browsing treetops with effortless elegance. Zebras, wildebeest, and a variety of antelope roam freely, while more than 500 bird species—including vibrant lilac-breasted rollers and stately marabou storks—bring the landscape to life. Each turn of the track offers new surprises, from animals at watering holes to unexpected predator-prey interactions, making every moment an authentic safari adventure. After a morning of thrilling wildlife encounters, return to the lodge for lunch before continuing to Lake Manyara National Park. Known for its spectacular scenery and abundant wildlife, the park provides more opportunities to spot hippos, baboons, and tree-climbing lions. Arrive in the late afternoon to settle in for dinner and overnight. Accommodation: camp or lodge on a full board basis.

Begin the day with an exhilarating morning game drive in Lake Manyara National Park, where the park’s varied habitats reveal a rich array of wildlife. Spot hippos wallowing in the water, baboons leaping through the trees, and the famous tree-climbing lions surveying their domain. Return to the lodge for lunch before setting out on the next stage of your adventure. Depart for the legendary Serengeti National Park, one of Africa’s most iconic wildlife destinations. As you pass through Naabi Gate, the gateway to the Serengeti, the excitement builds—open plains stretch out ahead, dotted with acacia trees and roaming wildlife. Begin game viewing immediately, with opportunities to see zebras, wildebeest, giraffes, and possibly predators stalking their prey, all against the vast, timeless backdrop of the Serengeti. Continue through the park en route to your lodge, where you arrive in the late afternoon. Relax, enjoy dinner, and reflect on the sights of your first day in this world-renowned wilderness. Overnight at the camp or lodge on a full board basis.

A full day of morning and afternoon game drives in Serengeti National Park: immersive journeys into one of Africa’s most iconic wildernesses, where every moment is alive with the sights, sounds, and rhythms of the wild. As the sun rises over golden savannahs, the morning drive brings the first signs of life: lions yawning and stretching under acacia trees, cheetahs slipping silently through the grass, and herds of wildebeest and zebras moving purposefully across the plains. The air is filled with birdsong, and vibrant species like lilac-breasted rollers and kori bustards punctuate the landscape with color. Your guide tracks wildlife, pointing out subtle signs—paw prints, feeding marks, and distant movements—transforming the drive into a dynamic, interactive experience. Afternoon drives offer a different energy as the sun dips toward the horizon. Elephants gather at watering holes, buffalo roam in slow, majestic processions, and predators begin their evening hunts. The interplay of light, shadow, and wildlife creates cinematic moments, perfect for photography or quiet reflection. Between sightings, pause to absorb the vastness of the Serengeti, the endless sky above, and the hum of life all around, feeling fully connected to this timeless ecosystem. Each drive is a blend of discovery, wonder, and raw adventure.

Depart the lodge and begin your journey toward the Ngorongoro Conservation Area, enjoying your final game viewing in the Serengeti. As you drive across the vast plains and acacia woodlands, watch for elephants moving gracefully across the savannah, lions resting in the shade, giraffes browsing treetops, and herds of wildebeest and zebras in motion. Your guide will point out subtle signs of wildlife—tracks, feeding areas, and distant movements—making every moment a chance for discovery. Pause en route for a packed picnic lunch, surrounded by the sights and sounds of the bush, before continuing to your camp or lodge. Arrive in the late afternoon for dinner and overnight.

Depart early and descend into the floor of the Ngorongoro Crater for an unforgettable day of game viewing. This 102-square-mile wildlife haven is home to over 30,000 mammals, offering excellent opportunities to spot the Big Five—lions, elephants, buffalo, rhinos, and leopards—alongside zebras, wildebeest, and a variety of antelope. Pause for a picnic lunch at a scenic spot on the crater floor, surrounded by the sights and sounds of this extraordinary ecosystem. In the afternoon, continue exploring the crater before ascending back to the rim, taking in the sweeping panoramic views one last time. Return to your camp or lodge in the late afternoon for dinner and overnight.

After breakfast, you depart the camp/lodge and begin your journey back to Arusha arriving in the city for lunch (excludes drinks). Then transfer to Nairobi and drop off at Nairobi’s Jomo Kenyatta International Airport for your departure flight. It is possible to leave the trip in Arusha and fly to Zanzibar for time on the beach.

tourName: Kenya and Tanzania tailor made safari
placesVisited: Amboseli National Park, Stunning views of Mount Kilimanjaro, Lake Manyara National Park and its tree-climbing lions, Ngorongoro Crater, Visit Olduvai Gorge, ‘the Cradle of Humankind’, Serengeti National Park, Masai Mara National Reserve, Explore Masai culture with a guided village visit, Lake Naivasha, Crescent Island
generalInfo:
Thrilling, unforgettable experiences abound on this Kenya and Tanzania tailor made safari. The trip has been designed to showcase some of the finest wildlife-watching in all of Africa, while ensuring you’re accommodated in comfort and style throughout. Exploring some of the continent’s most renowned national parks and reserves you’ll stay in a succession of luxurious lodges that have been strategically located to place you in the very heart of the action.

Immense herds of elephants range across Amboseli National Park, its skyline dominated by the majestic Mount Kilimanjaro, highest peak in Africa. In Lake Manyara, the lions find a breeze and respite from insects by climbing trees, which also gives them ideal vantage points for spotting prey. And in the spectacular Ngorongoro Crater, sometimes described as ‘the eight wonder of the world’, you’ll discover a unique biosphere teeming with wildlife, set against a backdrop of lakes, forest and dormant volcanoes.

Safaris are taken in the mornings and late afternoons, avoiding the worst of the heat while also ensuring you find the animals at their most active. Driver-guides, drawn from local Masai communities, are trained to put the interests of the animals first. They’ll help you get some memorable sightings while also making sure that the wildlife, and the habitats they rely upon, are not disturbed by your presence.

Among the moments likely to be most treasured are an (optional) hot air balloon flight over the plains at sunrise, as the Masai Mara wakes up beneath you. Another will surely be spending time at a Masai village, where local guides can explain traditional culture and ways of life to you, and help you share a little of your own lives with your hosts. These are communities that benefit hugely from responsible tourism, supplying lodges with fresh-grown produce, guiding, and selling their handicrafts to visitors. In some cases just a snatch of conversation with a villager, or a moment of mutual connection, can be one of the highlights of your trip.

Your final stop is Crescent Island on Lake Naivasha, in Kenya’s Great Rift Valley. The wildlife populations here are exceptional, and admiring the lakeside setting from a hilltop during the ‘golden hour’ before sunset encapsulates everything that makes an African safari so splendid. One of the many reasons for choosing a Kenya and Tanzania tailor made safari is that it can create moments like this for you to enjoy, every single day.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL /NAIROBI JAMBO! Upon arrival at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport in Nairobi, you will be met by our Customer Care Representative who will assist you with the transfer to your hotel. Before checking in at hotel, he will brief you on your program ahead and introduce the Driver Guide who will be with you throughout the safari.

AMBOSELI NATIONAL PARK This morning after breakfast, you will drive to Amboseli National Park which is famous for its large elephant population roaming across the vast grassy plains, the big five, and the majestic views of Mt. Kilimanjaro the highest mountain in Africa among other species of flora and fauna. Lunch will be at your lodge before proceeding for an afternoon for a game viewing drive.

AMBOSELI NATIONAL PARK Full day in the Amboseli National Park with two game drives. You drive through across this vast lake bed, often dry but swampy in some areas. We have a lot of game here like cheetah, buffalo, giraffe, gazelles and herds of elephants all set against the amazing back drop of majestic Mount Kilimanjaro showing all its glory. If you wish, for a nominal fee, you can also visit a Masai Village to experience this nomadic tribe’s way of life and see their colorful culture.

LAKE MANYARA NATIONAL PARK After breakfast drive to the beautiful Lake Manyara, a shallow alkaline lake that shimmers in a cleft in the Great Rift Valley. Customs and border formalities will be at Namanga border before proceeding for lunch in Arusha. Then drive to enjoy an afternoon game viewing in Lake Manyara National Park famous for its tree climbing lions. Later return to your lodge for dinner and overnight.

NGORONGORO CONSERVATION AREA This morning relaxation at your lodge before departing for Ngorongoro Conservation Area. The famous Ngorongoro Crater Conservation Area (NCCA) features rolling plains, lakes, craters, mountains and dormant volcanoes. Hot lunch will be at your lodge before relaxation or an optional cultural village visit.

NGORONGORO CONSERVATION AREA After breakfast, descend into the ‘8th Wonder of the World’, a unique biosphere that has remained virtually unchanged since the dawn of time. Enclosed within its towering walls are grasslands, swamps, forests, saltpans, a fresh water lake and a glorious variety of birdlife. Here too are all the members of the ‘Big Five’ (lion, elephant, rhino, leopard and buffalo) as well as a large cast of plains game and one of Africa’s densest populations of predators. Enjoy a picnic lunch on the crater floor before climbing back up to the lodge in time for relaxation before dinner.

SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK After breakfast, drive through NCCA with picnic lunch boxes and cross into neighboring Serengeti National Park stopping en route at Ol Duvai Gorge. Known as the ‘Cradle of Mankind’, this is one of the most important prehistoric sites in the world. Pioneered by famous paleontologists Louis and Mary Leakey in the 1950s it offers a glimpse into life two million years ago. Arrive at your lodge in time to relax and enjoy a classic safari supper.

SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK After breakfast, enjoy a full day’s game driving (meals taken in true safari style ‘in the bush’) in the vast and sensational Serengeti, which covers 14,763 sq km of endlessly rolling savannah. Venue for ‘the greatest wildlife show on Earth’, the annual migration of over one million wildebeest, the park is also renowned for its lions, cheetahs, zebras, giraffes and plains game. Overnight at the lodge.

MASAI MARA NATIONAL RESERVE After breakfast and a short briefing by your driver guide, drive to the world-famous Masai Mara National Reserve, backdrop to 'the greatest wildlife spectacle on earth', the annual migration of over one million wildebeest. Stopping en route at Isebania border for customs and migration formalities. You will enjoy picnic lunch boxes en route before driving to arrive in time for late afternoon game viewing drive in Kenya's most popular reserve. Arrive back in lodge in time for campfire cocktails and dinner.

MARA NATIONAL RESERVE Your day will be spent on safari in Africa's richest wildlife viewing arena. Historically teeming with wildlife, the Mara hosts Kenya's largest lion prides and elephant herds. Other predators include leopard, cheetah and spotted hyena; while in the Mara River you will see fat pods of hippo and vast Nile crocodiles. Other highlights include giraffe tops, gazelle, zebra, buffalo and over 550 species of birds. Take the opportunity to fly over the Mara in a Hot air Balloon at an extra cost. The balloon package includes a champagne breakfast in the wild! If you can spare the money, viewing abundant game afloat a balloon is an unforgettable experience. Alternatively visit a Masai village and get learn the Masai culture at an extra cost.
LAKE NAIVASHA/LAKE ELEMENTAITA After your breakfast, you will depart for Lake Naivasha/Lake Elementaita to arrive in time for check in and late lunch followed by relaxation at your camp.

CRESENT ISLAND VISIT/LAST MINUTE SHOPPING/DEPARTURE This morning enjoy a morning boat ride to the crescent island - The Park where you walk with the Animals! There is just one “Crescent Island Game Park” and it is located on Lake Naivasha, Kenya in the Great Rift Valley. There are more animals per acre than any other Kenyan Park, hence many film companies have been to the Island to film the herds of Wildebeest, Waterbuck, Zebra and Gazelle. They are not fenced in, which allows the wildlife on the mainland to come in as they lose their habitat to development and the ever increasing population. Hippo graze all over us at night then sleep under the acacia or rest in the water by day. The giraffe who were born on the Island return to give birth; sometimes you see three generations at a time. Hyena come to hunt at night but are not resident on the island, the many python that live here can be seen occasionally with a kill. Groups of Buffalo come and go but they are always monitored. From the top of the hill there is a 360 degree view across the Lake from Longonot to Hell’s Gate to the Mau Escarpment to Eburu and onto the Aberdares. Walking along the ridge in the golden hour before sunset whilst watching the animals grazing with the water shimmering beyond is what Africa is all about. Take a boat back to the lodge. Drive back to Nairobi, passing .You will arrive in Kenya's bustling capital city Nairobi in the early afternoon. Spend time doing last minute shopping. Lunch is your own arrangements Transfer to Nairobi’s Jomo Kenyatta International Airport in time for your departure flight. Bid farewell to Africa until the next time Say good bye to the wonderful country and promise to join us on another expedition!

tourName: Kenya and Zanzibar Honeymoon
generalInfo:
An exhilarating Masai Mara safari experience in Kenya, followed by lazy days relaxing on the exotic island of Zanzibar: this honeymoon is the perfect combination of adventure, relaxation and romance.

Game drives on the Mara offer some of the best wildlife viewing destinations on the continent, as the national park is famous for big cats (lion, leopard and cheetah can all be found here), as well as zebra, wildebeest, buffalo, impala, gazelle and elephant, whilst crocs and hippos lurk in the rivers. Time your visit well and you may witness the Great Migration of zebra and wildebeest as they make their annual cycle around East Africa.

Next, you'll swap the wild expanses of Kenya's national parks for the white sand and sparkling turquoise waters of Zanzibar, a semi-autonomous island off the coast of Tanzania. Stay on an exclusive private island, bask in tropical paradise and watch spectacular sunsets dip below the ocean horizon.

Luxury accommodation is selected based on your specific requirements, preferences and tastes, plus activities and excursions such as a sunrise hot air balloon flight over the plains of the Masai Mara followed by a champagne breakfast, or a romantic beach dinner under the stars.

Participate in adventurous game drives, stay in world-class safari lodges and relax in idyllic beach tranquillity on an intimate East African honeymoon - the perfect start to married life.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Kenya - As soon as you disembark the aircraft from your international flight, you will receive a warm welcome from a friendly representative who will escort you through immigration, customs and baggage collection, and they will remain with you until you meet your driver in the arrivals area. You will then be transferred to the domestic airport, where you’ll board a light aircraft flight to the Masai Mara. Upon arrival at the Masai Mara you will be driven to your safari lodge or camp, where you will stay for the next four nights. We use a number of different award-winning safari camps and luxury lodges within the Masai Mara and we will ensure that we match you to the most suitable accommodation for your requirements and sense of style.

Explore the Masai Mara - During the next three days you’ll enjoy two game drives per day on the plains of the Masai Mara, where you’ll spot an abundance of African wildlife. This iconic reserve offers amazing wildlife viewing opportunities and it’s highly likely that you’ll see zebra, impala, gazelle, wildebeest, buffalo, rhino and elephant; plus lions, cheetahs and leopards. Your lodge or camp may also offer the opportunity for a night game drive, where you’ll see nocturnal animals, such as aardvarks and honey badgers. As well as game drives, there are a range of other activities you can participate in during your time in the Masai Mara, including cultural visits to Maasai villages and markets, guided bush walks, horse riding, black rhino tracking experiences, or you may wish to take an early morning hot air balloon flight over the plains and forests of the Masai Mara.

Transfer to Zanzibar - Enjoy an early morning game drive before being driven to the airstrip in time for your scheduled light aircraft flight to Nairobi, where you’ll board a connecting flight to the exotic island of Zanzibar. You will be met on arrival in Zanzibar and driven to your accommodation, where you will stay for the next four nights. We offer a range of accommodation options on the island and we will ensure that we match you to the most suitable accommodation for your requirements and sense of style – whether that's a rustic beach lodge or a luxurious 5-star resort.

Explore Zanzibar - With its golden sunsets, beautiful sandy beaches, clear turquoise waters and colourful coral reefs, Zanzibar is the perfect honeymoon destination. There are plenty of excursions that you can join during your time on the island, including visits to historic Stone Town, Jozani Forest, Prison Island, the spice plantations and cultural tours to local villages. There’s also a wide choice of adventure activities that you can participate in, including mountain biking, hiking, bird-watching, wind-surfing, kite-surfing, kayaking and sailing. Plus, the island has fantastic coral reefs, which are perfect for diving and snorkelling – and you may even be lucky enough to see dolphins, green turtles and at certain times of the year, whale sharks.

Depart from Zanzibar - After breakfast, you’ll check out of your accommodation and transfer to Abeid Amani Karume International Airport (ZNZ) for your flight home. You'll be sad to leave these area of abundant natural beauty, but you'll return home with incredible memories of your Kenya and Zanzibar honeymoon.

tourName: Kenya cheetah safari
placesVisited: Great Rift Valley, Ol Pejeta Conservancy and Mount Kenya, Lake Naivisha, Masai Mara, Distinctive luxury waterside accommodation
generalInfo:
For those looking for a slightly different tour, this safari starts with 2 nights sightseeing in Nairobi, then to the stunning views of Mount Kenya, featuring Ol Pejeta Conservancy: home to Rhinos and Chimpanzees, on to the glorious and world-renowned Masai Mara Reserve and the beautiful Lake Nakuru National Park…a paradise for bird watchers and wildlife lovers alike.
This small group road safari offers optimum game-viewing options visiting the highlights of Kenya’s safari destinations and the opportunity to view ‘The Big Five’ against exceptionally varied backdrops. The safari is operated both on scheduled dates for small groups and also on a private basis (on request)

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, you will be met by our representative and transferred to Novotel Westlands. Dinner (not included) can be taken at the hotel or at any of the cities many restaurants. Overnight at Novotel Westlands Nairobi (superior room)-Bed and Breakfast included

Kick off your Nairobi adventure with a full-day tour blending wildlife, culture, and history. Begin at the Giraffe Centre, where you can feed endangered Rothschild’s giraffes and learn about Kenya’s vital conservation efforts. This up-close encounter with these gentle giants is both magical and educational, providing perfect photo opportunities. Next, visit the Karen Blixen Museum, the preserved farmhouse of the Out of Africa author. Explore antique furnishings, personal artifacts, and sweeping views of the Ngong Hills, immersing yourself in colonial-era life and the legacy of one of Kenya’s most famous residents. Pause for lunch at Karen Blixen Coffee Gardens, enjoying international cuisine infused with authentic Kenyan flavors in serene, shaded surroundings. In the afternoon, head to the Kobe Tough Beads Factory, a women’s cooperative creating exquisite handmade beadwork. Witness artisans at work and learn how the cooperative empowers local women while sustaining livelihoods. Purchase unique creations directly to support their mission. The evening culminates at Safari Cats with a dazzling open-air dinner and performance, featuring acrobatics, dance, and live music celebrating African culture. Overnight accommodations are at Novotel Westlands Nairobi in a superior room, with dinner included and breakfast the next morning. This action-packed day offers the perfect introduction to Kenya’s wildlife, history, and vibrant culture.

After an early breakfast, set out northwards toward Nanyuki, entering the pristine wilderness of Ol Pejeta Conservancy. Upon arrival, check in to Sweetwaters Tented Camp, a tranquil oasis nestled around a bustling waterhole. Here, the rhythm of the bush sets the pace—luxury tents with private verandas provide front-row seats to wildlife as animals come to drink, blending safari adventure with under-canvas charm. In the afternoon, embark on your first game drive in Ol Pejeta, tracking rhinos, lions, and other iconic wildlife across sweeping plains under the shadow of Mount Kenya. Enjoy drinks at the Waterhole Bar, built like a game-viewing hide, where sipping a sundowner as elephants and zebras drink creates unforgettable moments. Dinner is served in the Rhino Restaurant, housed in the former colonial manager’s house, which serves a delicious mix of regional and international cuisine, while the Khashoggi Bar offers cozy evenings around a crackling log fire. Distance/drive time: 216 km / 3½ hours

Wake to the sounds of the African bush and begin a full day of adventure in Ol Pejeta Conservancy, with morning and afternoon game drives revealing some of Kenya’s most iconic wildlife. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are served at Sweetwaters Serena Camp – Morani, where the serene setting around waterholes brings wildlife right to your doorstep. During the day, visit the Rhino and Chimpanzee Sanctuaries, witnessing firsthand the conservancy’s life-saving work in protecting endangered species and rehabilitating rescued animals. From a colonial cattle ranch to a conservation pioneer, Ol Pejeta is now East Africa’s largest black rhino sanctuary and home to two of the world’s last northern white rhinos. With thriving predator populations and a successful livestock programme, the conservancy balances wildlife protection with community development, supporting education, healthcare, and infrastructure for surrounding communities. As the sun sets over the plains, return to camp for dinner under the stars, reflecting on a day filled with wildlife, wonder, and inspiration.

After breakfast, journey south toward Lake Nakuru National Park, pausing at Thompson Falls to enjoy a scenic picnic lunch amid cascading waters. As you continue, the landscape transforms, hinting at the unique beauty of the Great Rift Valley. Arriving in the afternoon, check in to Lake Nakuru Sopa Lodge, perched on hills that frame the western escarpment and overlook the sparkling lake. From your vantage point, flamingos dot the shoreline, and the vast bushy grasslands stretch toward the horizon, teeming with wildlife. Embark on an afternoon game drive, where black and white rhinos graze peacefully alongside giraffes, zebras, and impalas. Bird watchers will delight in the kaleidoscope of species that make the lake their home. Every moment is a sensory feast: the mirrored lake waters, the scent of wild grasses, the distant calls of animals. Lake Nakuru is a sanctuary of wildlife and natural beauty, offering an unforgettable, immersive safari experience.

Spend a full day on safari in Lake Nakuru National Park, home to white rhinos, elusive leopards, and diverse birdlife, including pelicans. Though flamingo numbers have declined, the park’s rich wildlife and scenic beauty remain captivating. Enjoy all meals at the lodge and overnight in a standard room at Lake Nakuru Sopa Lodge.

After breakfast, depart the lodge and journey across the floor of the Great Rift Valley, arriving at the world-famous Masai Mara National Reserve and checking in at Kilima Camp Masai Mara. Perched at 1,850 meters, the camp offers breathtaking views over the Mara plains and the Mara River below. Small and intimate, Kilima Camp provides a warm, welcoming “home away from home” for safari guests. Enjoy a leisurely lunch at the camp before setting out for an afternoon game drive. The Masai Mara is renowned as the stage for ‘the greatest wildlife show on earth’—home to the annual wildebeest migration and a rich array of predators and herbivores. Rolling grasslands, meandering rivers, and dramatic escarpments create an unforgettable backdrop for wildlife encounters. Return to camp in the evening to relax on your private veranda before enjoying dinner in the central restaurant. All meals and overnight at Kilima Camp Masai Mara or similar classic tent – LDBB. Distance/drive time: 365 km / 5½ hours

Spend a full day immersed in the Masai Mara, with morning and afternoon game drives showcasing the reserve’s unparalleled wildlife. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are served at Kilima Camp Masai Mara, where comfort meets the wild. The Mara’s hauntingly beautiful landscapes are alive with wildlife and vibrant birdlife, offering some of Africa’s most thrilling encounters. Here, the density and variety of animals provide an extraordinary chance to see all members of the Big Five in a single morning. Every drive promises unforgettable moments—from lions lounging in the grass to elephants moving majestically across the plains. Return to camp to relax, enjoy meals, and soak in the sights and sounds of the Mara from the comfort of your classic tent. All meals and overnight at Kilima Camp Masai Mara or a similar camp – LDBB.

Spend the day immersed in the Masai Mara, Africa’s iconic safari landscape, with morning and afternoon game drives revealing its incredible wildlife. Experience predators on the move at dawn and watch elephants, giraffes, and plains game graze beneath acacia trees in the golden afternoon light. The Mara truly is nature’s grandest stage. For a once-in-a-lifetime perspective, take an optional hot air balloon safari at sunrise. Drift silently above the plains, spotting elephants, hippos, and predators, then enjoy a champagne breakfast in the bush. Back at camp, relax and recount the day’s thrilling encounters over dinner, as the sounds of the wilderness surround you. All meals and overnight at Kilima Camp Masai Mara or a similar classic tent – LDBB, blending comfort with the raw beauty of the Mara.

Your final morning in the Masai Mara begins with an early breakfast at camp before embarking on one last game drive. As the morning light spills across the plains, enjoy lingering wildlife encounters—elephants moving in family groups, giraffes browsing acacia trees, and antelope grazing in the soft glow. While all vehicles must exit the park by 10 a.m., the journey toward the gates often reveals more unforgettable sights. From the Mara, travel back toward Nairobi, stopping for a scenic picnic lunch along the way. By late afternoon, arrive in the city, marking the official end of your safari. For those wishing to extend the adventure, seamless connections to Kenya’s coast are available, offering white-sand beaches, warm Indian Ocean waters, and a perfect balance of relaxation after your thrilling safari.

tourName: Kenya community and people tour, 3 days
generalInfo: This unique three day community and cultural safari will take you on insightful visits to three communities and the sustainable projects that, together are forging change in communities challenged by adversity.  You will team up with the various local leaders and social workers who are dedicated to improving the life of Kenyan people at both a women’s vocational and lifestyle training centre and a farm project to help grandmother-headed households. You will then visit the traditional Maasai heartlands of Kiserian and Ngong  to meet members of this fascinating tribe. And you can immerse yourself in the midst of the daily hustle and bustle of Maasai village life as you take part in the rituals of the Maasai warriors, sit with the women as they perform their daily tasks, and listen to stories and folklore told by village elders. These wonderful interactions show you day-to-day Kenyan culture and connect with people on a personal level.

dayInfo.description: The Inspirations of One Woman. Today we drive to a developing area in the west of Nairobi and visit a Women's Empowerment Centre, which is the first of the sustainable projects and communities that you will visit. It was started by Mary a Kenyan social worker, who developed a program to help struggling mothers undertake vocational and lifestyle training and get access to microfinance to open small businesses. The results have been phenomenal as the mothers are able to lift themselves out of poverty and transform into independent business owners and community leaders, and crucially support and keep their families together. Spend time with Mary to learn about her vision for the centre while you get the opportunity to meet some of the proud and self-sufficient women involved in the inspirational program.

New Beginnings for Grandmas. There are many grandmother-headed households in Kenya who care for their grandchildren among other generations of their family in difficult economic circumstances. You will visit a pig farm owned by one grandmother where she proudly explains pig-husbandry and how her bio-gas system powers her home. This is the second of three sustainable projects and the initiative aims at improving the livelihoods of the grandmothers by economically empowering them through small-scale farming. Then sit down with the grandmothers while they cook traditional meals for their families and narrate their wonderful stories of life, change and progress.

The Maasai Rites of Passage. Spend an amazing day with the warriors and women of a traditional Maasai village. It starts with a song and dance welcome where the wife of a village elder will offer to dress you in traditional Maasai shuka cloth or ‘African blanket’. Venture into the bush with her son, who will explain what it’s like being a young warrior in Maasai society, and join other men who are training for their rite of passage as they explain how they will go into the hills to complete qualifying tasks before they reach the circumcision ceremony. Take part in the challenge as they show you how to throw a spear and climb an acacia tree in lightning speed. Sit with the villagers as they share their stories of their fascinating culture with you while the women teach you how to make some traditional decorative beaded jewellery. And as the Maasai adapt to a semi nomadic future they have had to adapt some practices of land use by embracing bio gas systems. This program aims to eliminate the need to cut down precious forests for firewood for cooking and replacing it with the gas from the biogas. The gas saves the forest from being cut down and helps restore the raspatory health of the villagers caused by smoke inhalation

tourName: Kenya culture and community tour
generalInfo: This eye-opening 6-day cultural safari gives travellers the opportunity to meet Kenyans from various walks of life and hear their inspirational stories. At some of the worthwhile projects that make it possible for people to gain the strength and courage to break free from poverty. Give the gift of time at a soup kitchen to feed hungry children, meet the steadfast grandmothers who run enterprises to support the younger generations, and see how a vocational training project empowers women and keeps families together. Additionally we have also included some sightseeing and some delicious meals out for an all-round Nairobi experience, and you visit a Maasai village and become an honorary member of the tribe, and enjoy some relaxing time at beautiful Lake Naivasha.

dayInfo.description: Help at a Soup Kitchen. Getting involved in helping disadvantaged communities is both an opportunity to engage with local people and a rewarding way for travellers to contribute to alleviating the problems of poverty in Kenya. Today you visit a family centre on the outskirts of Nairobi which provides the families with their only regular meal each day. You lend a hand by helping to prepare and distribute nutritious food, and witness firsthand how communities work together to help the hungry and most vulnerable.

They Said It Cannot Be Done. Today you visit the Women's Empowerment Centre, another project where local women undertake an 18-month program that teaches them trade and entrepreneurial skills so they can set up their own business to support their families. Spend an inspirational day with these proud, self-sufficient women and gain a better understanding of how they have been able to overcome difficult challenges and transform into independent business owners and community leaders.

The Hippos of Lake Naivasha. Today drive west of Nairobi to Lake Naivasha, Kenya's most beautiful freshwater lake surrounded by peaceful grassy banks and fringed by thick papyrus. Along the way, stop at a roadside lookout for the stunning views over Kenya’s Great Rift Valley, and arrive at a lovely lakeside lodge in huge grounds studded with acacia trees and perhaps spot the odd antelope or vervet monkey. Catch a small boat to view the pods of hippos and abundant birdlife that Naivasha is so famous for, then back at the lodge enjoy a delicious leisurely lunch and relaxing swim in the pool before returning to Nairobi in the late afternoon.

Grandmothers Love Their Pigs. Today you will visit another local community to meet some of the endearing and entrepreneurial Kenyan grandmothers who play a vital role in keeping Kenyan families together. Discover how pig-husbandry provides food and financial support and the bio-gas system creates energy out of the waste to power a home. This is another worthwhile project and the initiative aims to empower grandmothers through small-scale farming. Sit with them over a cup of local tea and enjoy some joyful singing and dancing and listen to their powerful stories about resilience.

Become a Maasai for the Day. Spend an amazing day with the warriors and women of a traditional Maasai village. It starts with a song and dance welcome where the wife of a village elder will offer to dress you in traditional Maasai shuka cloth or ‘African blanket’. Venture into the bush with her son, who will explain what it’s like being a young warrior in Maasai society, sit with the elders as they share their stories of their fascinating culture, and learn from the women how to make some traditional decorative beaded jewellery.

A Great Way to End the Week. Your final day will be spent relaxing at leisure, giving you the opportunity to reflect on the amazing experiences over the past few days as you fondly remember the warm and welcoming, and fascinating and inspirational Kenyan people you have met and connected with. A mid-morning pickup takes you to the restaurant at the Karen Blixen Coffee Garden for a delicious lunch in the pretty gardens to celebrate the end of your 6-day tour, before you make your way to the airport to catch your flight.

tourName: Kenya expedition to Lake Turkana
generalInfo:
Kenya is renowned for its wealth of wildlife, the sweeping plains of the Masai Mara, and its white sand beaches. But look beyond these stereotypes, glorious though they are, and one can find a diverse kaleidoscope of ethnicities and tribal groups, far removed from the tourist trail and virtually unchanged for generations. On this expedition we head north from the capital to Samburu Game Reserve – no visit to Kenya would be complete without at least a little wildlife, after all. We spend a day here on game drives looking for lion, elephant and some of the species which are seldom found elsewhere, such as gerenuk and beisa oryx.

We then drive into the tribal heartlands that stretch towards the borders with South Sudan and Ethiopia, taking challenging routes and driving through remote areas to meet some of Africa’s most traditional groups. We meet the Samburu and Rendille people, pastoralists who compensate for their austere surroundings with stunning body decorations and enormous beaded necklaces.

Continuing to the Chalbi Desert we head for the oasis of Kalacha, a centre for the Gabbra people, camel herding nomads who eke an existence from this unforgiving land. Pushing further north we drive to the ‘Jade Sea’, the vast waters of Lake Turkana – one of East Africa’s most remote regions. Here we meet the Turkana people, a proud warrior people who held out against colonial domination until the 1950s, and who still retain a fierce independence from central government.

This is a trip through some of East Africa’s most isolated regions – you can expect some full days of driving on rough and non-existent roads to reach these communities, and at times it may be challenging. The rewards however are great – to meet proud warriors and nomadic communities following in the steps of their ancestors, with little influence from the modern world, masters of their own lands yet welcoming to visitors. This is Kenya with a twist, and unlike you have seen it before.

dayInfo.description: Nairobi - Arrive in Nairobi. The rest of the day is at leisure. Overnight Emory Hotel or similar.

Samburu National Reserve - Drive to Samburu National Reserve where we will have an afternoon game drive. Samburu is home to a number of species rarely seen elsewhere such as the reticulated giraffe and gerenuk, and we spend our time searching for these and other wildlife. Overnight Samburu Simba Lodge or similar. (BLD)

Samburu - Ngurunit - Drive to Ngurunit, located at the base of the Ndoto Mountains where we explore the lands of the Samburu and Rendille people, two of Kenya’s most striking ethnic groups. We visit their settlements and learn about their way of life in this harsh corner of the country. Overnight Camp Ndotto or similar. (BLD)
Kargi - ontinue to the village of Kargi in the heart of the Chalbi desert. Kargi is home to the Rendille group and we spend time here immersing ourselves in their culture. Overnight camping. (BLD)

Chalbi Desert - A long drive to Kenya’s remote northern frontier, eventually arriving at Kalacha, a desert oasis that sustains the Gabbra people and their cattle during the dry season. We spend our time here meeting the Gabbra in the Chalbi Desert. Overnight camping. (BLD)

Loyangalani - Drive across some of East Africa’s most dramatic scenery to Loyangalani. The frontier town is a melting pot of ethnic groups, and divides neatly into tribal zones; the Samburu, Turkana and Rendille have each made one part of the town their home. Overnight Oasis Hotel or similar. (BLD)

South Horr - We move away from Lake Turkana and drive towards South Horr, heading to the lands of the Samburu people. We camp in the valley of Samburu’s sacred mountain, Oldonyo Nyiru and explore the surrounding Samburu villages. Overnight camping. (BLD)

Maralal - This morning, we have a long drive towards Maralal, the capital of the Samburu county. Upon arrival, we have a walk around the city to get a sense of local life here. Overnight Samburu Guest House or similar. (BLD)

Churo - Head to the highlands, inhabited by the Pokot community. The Pokot people are mainly pastoralists and are distinguished by their giant beaded necklaces. We explore the village, learning about the daily lives of the villages and seeing some of the unique traditions found here. Overnight camping. (BLD)

Lake Baringo - We leave the village behind and make our way to Lake Baringo, one of the Kenyan Rift Valley lakes. The lake is home to a number of species, including crocodiles and hippos and we enjoy a boat excursion in the hopes of spotting these. Overnight Tumbili Cliff Hotel or similar. (BLD)
Baringo - Nairobi - Return to Nairobi and transfer to the airport for departure. (BD)

tourName: Kenya family holiday
generalInfo:
Kenya is one of the most exciting destinations in Africa, a treasure trove of incredible wildlife, spectacular scenery and fabulous beaches. The children will adore everything about a safari, whether it is keeping their eyes peeled for 'the big five', eating dinner around a camp fire under a blanket of stars or taking a walking safari through a national park in search of some of Africa's less dangerous animals.
Key to a successful family holiday in Kenya is the accommodation and this holiday uses a number of different family friendly camps which have been hand picked for their ambience and facilities.
