Many are in stunning locations, with great views over the surrounding landscape and a comfortable bed at the end of the night in a deluxe safari tent or chalet. Most have swimming pools so that you can relax during the heat of the day, recharging the batteries before another game drive in search of lion, zebra, elephant, rhino and more.
Kenya also has some wonderful beaches with a wide variety of resorts ranging from large hotels with watersports, multiple pools and kids clubs to smaller and more informal boutique hotels with less facilities but a more personalised service. We will recommend a place that will suit your particular family.

dayInfo.description: NAIROBI Arrive in Nairobi and transfer to your hotel where the rest of the day is free for you to relax.

NAIROBI - MT KENYA In the morning your will visit Daphne Sheldrick’s Elephant Orphanage; the children will love being able to get ‘up close’ and watch the elephants playing and being fed. You will also visit the Langatta Giraffe Centre where the children will be able to hand-feed some of the animals. You will then head out of Nairobi towards Mount Kenya, arriving at your tented camp after approximately 3 hours.

OL PEJETA CONSERVANCY Great excitement this morning as you head off on your first game drive in the Ol Pejeta Conservancy (also known as the Sweetwaters reserve). All of the ‘big 5’ can be found here (lion, rhino, leopard, elephant and buffalo) as well as zebra, giraffe, cheetah and many more.

LAKE NAKURU This morning you will depart for Lake Nakuru where you will take a game drive in the extraordinary National Park, renowned for its huge concentration of flamingos and over 460 species of birds.

LAKE NAIVASHA After a second game drive in Lake Nakuru National Park you will head for Lake Naivasha, passing Hells Gate National Park with its pair of massive red-tinged cliffs leading into dramatic scenery of steep cliffs, narrow gorges, bubbling geothermal pools and strange twisted rock formations. You will take high tea at Elsamere, home to Joy Adamson, a British naturalist and author of ‘Born Free’, a bestselling story about the trials and tribulations of raising a lion cub called Elsa.

LAKE NAIVASHA Lake Naivasha is the highest of the Rift Valley lakes, with clear blue waters leading to dense stands of thick papyrus and a backdrop of mountains. The views are gorgeous and the area also abounds with bird life. This morning for a change of scene and to keep the children interested, you will explore the lake by boat with excellent opportunities for spotting hippos and other animals that come to drink and wallow in the lake. In the afternoon you will take a guided nature walk through the yellow acacia forest around the lake; the children will really enjoy the chance to get up close with some of the smaller animals that are sometimes missed during game drives.
MASAI MARA Today there is quite a long drive to the Masai Mara (approximately 5½ hours). But oooh……when you arrive, it is all worth it!

MASAI MARA The Masai Mara is one of the finest game reserves in Africa, its rolling green plains and woodlands densely packed with a remarkable array of wildlife. All of the ‘big 5’ can be found here….make sure that the children keep their cameras at the ready. The scenery is also magnificent with endless plains, picturesque acacia trees and the spectacular Siria escarpment looming to the west. You will have both morning and afternoon game drives today.

MASAI MARA - MOMBASA An early morning departure for the drive back to Nairobi, through attractive coffee plantations and bustling villages. On arrival you will board a regional flight to Mombasa, on the Indian Ocean. You will then be transferred to your resort, on the sparkling white sands of Nyali Beach. The children will think that they have arrived in paradise! There are a wide range of activities and water sports available, including fishing, tennis, volley ball, glass-bottomed boat rides and snorkelling. Total driving time is approximately 5 hours and the flight takes about 50 minutes.

MOMBASA (BEACH) Two wonderful full days to relax and enjoy the beach. The water of the Indian Ocean is beautifully warm and is perfect for children. Active families will have plenty to keep them occupied with opportunities to take a full day boat trip to a variety of excellent snorkelling spots where there are superb coral gardens and an abundance of sea life, or perhaps take a nature walk into the rainforest at Bamburi. Others may wish to relax on the beach and enjoy the occasional dip.
MOMBASA Time to say goodbye to Kenya and head home.

tourName: Kenya family safari and beach holiday
generalInfo:
Embark on an unforgettable Kenyan family safari, immersing yourself in three distinct ecosystems teeming with diverse species. Delve into the sprawling 14,000 acres of untamed wilderness at El Karama Ranch, a haven frequented by abundant wildlife. Experience the exclusivity of Mara House in the iconic Masai Mara, and indulge in prime wildlife viewing in the private Mara North Conservancy.

For the little ones, El Karama’s Kids Bush School offers bespoke, educational safari activities tailored to their interests throughout your stay, ensuring a memorable experience for the whole family.

From the Mara you will head down to Diani Beach to the Almanara Villas where you will be staying in a luxury villa for the next 4 nights.

Enjoy having some down time on the coast and at your beautiful villa. There are plenty of activities to get up to throughout your stay as well as lots of restaurant and bars to explore.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, a dedicated representative will greet you, and transfer you to Nairobi Wilson to catch your scenic flight up to Nanyuki. From there, your journey continues as you're met by your guide from El Karama Lodge who will take you there. After settling in, savour a lovely lunch at the camp before embarking on an afternoon game drive.

Your safari guide will provide a comprehensive briefing on the exciting itinerary planned for your two full days on El Karama Ranch. El Karama Ranch offers a range of activities suitable for the entire family. From day and night game drives to guided bush walks, fly camping adventures, and visits to the ranch and shamba, there's something for everyone to enjoy. Take a refreshing dip in the river, embark on a memorable camel trek, or delve into the rich cultural heritage of the local community. For the little ones, the Kids Bush School awaits! From 10:00 am to 12:30 pm daily, children of all ages can partake in engaging educational activities, including wildlife tracking, paw print cast making, hand line fishing, 'Poo' Safaris (yes, you read that right!), interactive kitchen sessions, and even termite clay sculpting and painting. It's an immersive learning experience they'll treasure forever.

Enjoy a locally sourced breakfast at El Karama before transferring to Nanyuki Airstrip for your flight to Mara North Airstrip. When you arrive at Mara North Airstrip you will be met by your guide from Mara Bush Houses who will take you on a game drive to camp. You will be staying here for the next 3 nights.

Your safari guide will provide a detailed overview of the schedule for game drives and activities during your two full days at Mara North Conservancy. During your time at Mara North Conservancy, you can embark on day and night game drives or guided bush walks. Additionally, you have the option to dedicate a day to exploring the Masai Mara Reserve or immersing yourself in the Masai culture through a cultural community visit.

Beach Time! After an early morning game drive on your last day in the Masai Mara, depart to Mara North Airstrip for your scheduled flight to Ukunda Airstrip. Upon reaching Ukunda Airstrip, you'll be greeted by a representative from Almanara Villas, who will take you to your exclusive luxury villa nestled along the picturesque Kenyan coast.

And Relax.. Indulge in ultimate relaxation within the confines of your private villa, lounging by the swimming pool or strolling along the white sands of Diani Beach. Enjoy round-the-clock personalised butler service and savour lovely seafood and Italian dishes infused with a unique Kenyan flair. For those seeking adventure, try activities such as kite surfing and stand-up paddleboarding across the tranquil waters of the Indian Ocean. Alternatively, embark on snorkelling or deep-sea diving excursions to uncover the mesmerising marine life beneath the surface.

Time to head home Take advantage of a leisurely morning at your own pace, followed by a final meal at your villa before your transfer to Ukunda Airstrip, ensuring you arrive in time for your scheduled flight to Wilson Airport. Upon arrival at Wilson Airport, a dedicated driver-guide will be awaiting you to ensure a smooth transfer to Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, ensuring you reach your departure gate with ample time for your journey homeward.

tourName: Kenya family small group holiday
placesVisited: Nairobi, Lake Nakuru, Elephant Orphanage and the Giraffe Centre, Lake Naivasha, Great Rift Valley, Loita Hills, Bush and riverside camps, All day game drive in Masai Mara National Reserve
generalInfo:
This eight day African adventure takes you from the hustle and bustle of Nairobi to the peace and tranquillity of the Masai Mara to ensure you get to appreciate all sides of Kenya, plus plenty more besides.

As this is a small group holiday for families (max 31 travellers) you’ll be able to make new friends along the way, with campsites on the banks of lakes Nakuru and Naivasha providing wildlife watching opportunities aplenty as well as lots of downtime moments to allow everyone to rest and relax.

After you’ve all caught your breath it’s time to ramp up the excitement as you journey into the Great Rift Valley and go on game drives in the Masai Mara National Reserve. Game drives and overland travel between a couple of the locations can be lengthy so this family holiday is better suited for older kids rather than little ones.

Conservation projects and meeting Masai communities further involve families with older children as well as opportunities to safely observe lions, cheetahs, zebras and rhinos in their natural environment.

From tribal culture to animal protection, local authorities and NGO’s are committed to keeping Kenya just as she’s been for generations which is good news for families looking for an authentic African experience that’s all set to enthrall and inspire in equal measures.

dayInfo.title: Nairobi.
dayInfo.description: Jambo! Welcome to Kenya. Your adventure begins in Nairobi Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 5 pm tonight. You can arrive at any time as there are no activities planned until this important meeting. If you and your family arrive early, perhaps maybe head out and explore visit the National Museum of Kenya, the Karen Blixen Museum or the highly recommended explore Bomas of Kenya where traditional homesteads of several Kenyan tribes are displayed in an outdoor village. Or, to get a glimpse of some animals, or head to the David Sheldricks Elephant Orphanage and the Giraffe Centre. After your meeting, maybe get to know the other families over dinner at a local restaurant.

dayInfo.title: Lake Nakuru .
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you and your family will visit Langata Giraffe Sanctuary. See the animals up close and learn about the sanctuary’s conservation project. Then, continue to Nairobi National Park – a large game reserve known for breeding endangered black rhinos. When you arrive, set up camp then watch the sunset as you sit down to dinner with your family.

dayInfo.title: Lake Naivasha .
dayInfo.description: Get the family together, and set out on an early morning game drive around Lake Nakuru. As you drive, be sure to look out for the white rhinos that can often be found around the shores. After, meet some of the friendly locals at the nearby village before continuing to Lake Naivasha. When you arrive, the rest of the day is free for you to explore camp at your own pace. Maybe hire a bike or simply relax or play a board game with your family.

dayInfo.title: Lake Naivasha.
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you and your family will head towards Crater Lake. When you arrive, lace up your walking shoes and set off on a guided walk along one of the many trails. The waters of the lake draw many animals to the area. As you walk, look for giraffes wandering among the acacia, buffaloes wallowing in the swamps and colobus monkeys calling from the treetops. Later, maybe take the family on an optional boat ride across the lake or simply relax at camp - the kids will love the nearby swimming pool!

dayInfo.title: Great Rift Valley and Loita Hills .
dayInfo.description: Say goodbye to Lake Naivasha as you travel to Loita Hills. Along the way, you’ll stop in Narok to get some groceries. Today's drive crosses the Great Rift Valley and into the remote region that’s home to the traditional Maasai people. Meet the Maasai warriors, who are known for their vibrant red dress and elaborate jewellery.Then, hear from a local elder as they teach you about Maasai and their history and culture. Later, you'll be shown around a traditional Maasai home and see where the resident cattle are kept.

dayInfo.title: Maasai Mara .
dayInfo.description: This morning, drive to the Masai Mara National Reserve – a large, preserved savannah along the Tanzanian border known for its grassy plains, rolling hills and wildebeest who traverse the plains during their annual migration. After setting up camp, sit down to some lunch, then head out on a 4WD game drive through the national reserve. Along the way, you’ll see animals like lions, cheetahs, elephants and zebras roaming the plains or drinking from nearby waterholes, so be sure to have your camera ready!

dayInfo.title: Maasai Mara .
dayInfo.description: Rise early and venture into the Masai Mara National Reserve for a full day of game driving. Explore this diverse environment and see a plenty of wildlife, like lions, elephants and cheetahs. After, head back to camp for lunch by the side of the Mara River – a great chance to spot crocodiles and hippos. Relax during the heat of the day before setting off on another game drive this afternoon. Tonight, maybe tell stories by the campfire or stargaze, before falling asleep to the sound of the wilderness.

dayInfo.title: Nairobi.
dayInfo.description: This morning, you’ll cross the plains of the Mara and climb the Rift Valley’s eastern wall past Mount Suswa on the return drive to Nairobi . En route, maybe stop for lunch or at a nearby town for one final bit of shopping.When you arrive in Nairobi, your adventure comes to an end. If you’d like to stay longer – and it’s recommended you do – just speak to your booking agent ahead of time.

tourName: Kenya flying safari
generalInfo:
This exclusive flying safari showcases some of Kenya’s most famous and most diverse wilderness areas, while travelling ‘on the wing’ allows you to optimize every minute of your Kenya stay.
Commencing in Amboseli, the fly-in Safari offers guaranteed sightings of large herds of elephant & giraffes crossing vast open plains against the backdrop of Mount Kilimanjaro. During the dry season months from June-Nov, sightings of elephant, zebra, buffalo, giraffe and wildebeest are common.

Flying northwards to the unique and less populated Loisaba, an area of dry acacia scrub with stretches of open grassland and riverine forest. This area is off the beaten safari track, but features good numbers of lion, cheetah, leopard and hyenas. Walking safaris are permitted here.

Thereafter you fly south-west to the Tanzanian border where the Masai Mara and the Serengeti share the same massive eco-system, which is most famous for the annual migration of the wildebeest. Travelling on light aircraft with personalized meet and greet services throughout, this safari is light on travel-time and long on safari experiences. It also features some of Kenya’s most charmingly luxurious tented camps.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Kenya! You shall arrive at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport where upon arrival, you will be welcomed and met by your Elewana representative and chauffeured to your hotel in Nairobi. Your 1 night stay at Hemingways Nairobi is on half board basis and drinks (excluding premium drinks).

Welcome Breakfast at Hemingways Nairobi. Check-out and transfer to Wilson Airport Nairobi, gateway to the flying safaris in Kenya. Time to board the Elewana Executive Grand Caravan. Your SkySafari will now take to the Air! Flight to Amboseli National Park. After a scenic 45 minutes flight, you will land in the middle of the Park, where the team from Tortilis Camp will warmly welcome you. Enjoy your first game drive en-route to the camp, where you will arrive in time for lunch. Afternoon game drive. Your stay at Tortilis Camp is for 2 nights in an en-suite Safari Tent, and is on all-inclusive basis (includes all meals, bush activities and drinks – excluding premium drinks).

Rise early to watch the African plains game wake up on a game drive and stop for a bush breakfast. Hot lunch will be served at the lodge. If you feel like stretching your legs and seeing the wilderness from a different perspective this afternoon there is a walking safari. Alternatively you can have another game drive, with both activities culminating in cocktails watching the sunset, before returning to camp for dinner.

Rise early for a game drive, back in time to the lodge for breakfast. Check out, and transfer back to the Amboseli airstrip. The plane will now take you North, to the Loisaba Conservancy,in Laikipia .The Loisaba Team will welcome you and you will be transferred to the camp, where lunch will be served.. Your stay at Elewana’s Loisaba Tented Camp is for 3 nights in a tent, and is on all-inclusive basis (includes all meals, bush activities and drinks – excluding premium drinks).

Early morning bush walk with traditional Samburu guides. You return to the camp for breakfast and then have a choice of relaxing or heading out on a shared game drive. Following lunch at the camp, you can take an afternoon shared game drive, go fishing, or visit the anti-poaching sniffer dog team. Sundowners are enjoyed in the bush followed by dinner under the stars at the camp.

Your sharing morning options include a game drive, horse or camelback exploration, or bush running/trekking. This is followed by a bush breakfast. Then return to the camp for time to relax and enjoy as spa treatment. Shared afternoon game drive with dinner at the camp and overnight under the stars in your star bed. Those not wishing to spend the night under the stars remain at Loisaba Tented Camp

After breakfast, your SkySafari pilot will be waiting to take you on a 90-minute flight to the world famous Masai Mara where you land in the middle of the reserve. The Sand River Masai Mara Team will welcome you at the Keekorok airstrip. You will be transferred to the camp with a game drive en-route. Dinner and overnight at the Camp Your stay at Sand River Masai Mara is for 3 nights in a Luxurious Safari Tent, and is on all-inclusive basis (includes all meals, bush activities and drinks – excluding premium drinks).

Following an early breakfast at the camp, you depart for a full day of shared game viewing in Masai Mara National Reserve. A picnic hamper lunch is served in the bush. In the afternoon, you visit a Masai village. You return to the camp for dinner under the stars and overnight.

You have an early start with a shared game drive arriving at your secluded bush breakfast. You then game view as you return to the camp for time at leisure and lunch. In the afternoon, you have your final shared game drive followed by sundowners in the bush. You enjoy a farewell dinner under the stars and overnight at the camp.

Following breakfast, you transfer to the airstrip for your SkySafari flight back to Nairobi’s Wilson Airport. You are met on arrival and transfer to Hemingways Nairobi where you have use of a day room. You then transfer to Nairobi’s Jomo Kenyatta International Airport for your departure flight

tourName: Kenya guided wildlife holiday
generalInfo:
A fabulous tour which starts off visiting the famous Masai Mara, situated in South West Kenya: renowned for being home to over a million wildebeest, zebra and antelope between July and October, when the migration of huge herds make a dash across the rivers. Predators such as lion, leopard, hyena and cheetah are abundant … this is the area of the Big 5 safari.

Travel across the ‘breadbasket’ of Kenya where acres of wheat and barley grow towards the Rift Valley lakes and Nakuru Park, home to black and white rhinos and the endangered Rothschild giraffe, together with abundance of flamingos and other waterfowl that frequent the lake. Continue your journey on to Amboseli park, for stunning views of Mount Kilimanjaro in neighbouring Tanzania. The mountain is crucial in supplying the plains here with a steady flow of water for feeding the various swamps and wetlands, thus attracting a huge variety of wildlife, including elephant, zebra, buffalo, giraffe, wildebeest and various grazing antelope.

After 2 nights in Amboseli, you journey back to Nairobi for your drop off around lunchtime at a city hotel or airport for your onward arrangements. If time and budget permits, why not fly on to the coast for a beach extension staying on the stunning Mombasa coastline, or even head to Zanzibar in neighbouring Tanzania for a little rest and relaxation to end this superb trip.

This fabulous 7 day/6 night trip includes airport transfers and a night in Nairobi at the start. There are 5 levels of accommodation to choose from, ranging from small tented camps, up to larger lodge style properties, and 5 weekly departures (Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday). This small group tour is guaranteed to depart with a minimum of 2 clients, max of 6 clients per vehicle and each passenger is guaranteed a window seat. It can also be taken on a privately guided basis.

Transportation is provided in 4 x 4’s with a pop up roof and an experienced English/bilingual speaking driver/guide.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival into Nairobi, clients will be met and transferred to their hotel where you will spend the night on a bed and breakfast basis (Check in time 14:00). Depending on time of arrival clients may choose to add an optional excursion.

Leaving Nairobi after breakfast, approx. 07:30, you travel towards Kenya's fertile highlands and head down the rift escarpment on the road built by Italian prisoners of war during World War II. On the way, spot the charming chapel built at the foot of the escarpment. Pass the impressive Longonot earth satellite station as you head across the valley to Narok; continue your travels across acres of wheat and barley, before reaching the world-renowned Masai Mara in time for lunch. Following lunch, set off on your first game drive, returning to the lodge as the sun sets for drinks and dinner. Drive time approx: 3-5.5 hours dependent on accommodation

Following an early breakfast, depart on an exhilarating morning game drive: as the African sun rises, so the wildlife are on the move, herbivores seeking shelter from the sun and from predators. You may come across herds of elephant, zebras and antelope, or a pride of lion on the hunt. You return to the camp mid-morning. After lunch, and perhaps a siesta, set off on another game drive and visit to a Masai Village, to see how the Masai have lived for centuries, returning to your lodge as the sun sets for dinner and overnight

Leaving the Masai Mara after breakfast, travel across the ‘breadbasket’ of Kenya, where acres of wheat and barley litter the landscape, and then across the vast plains on the floor of the Rift Valley, keeping an eye out for herds of giraffe and gazelle as you head up the Mai -Mahiu, before arriving at Lake Nakuru around midday. Once in the park/conservancy, you can expect to see more wildlife en route to the lodge. Following lunch and a siesta, there is an afternoon game drive, returning to the lodge as the sun sets. The national park, known for its birdlife, offers a possibility to view flamingoes. It is also home to Black and White rhinos as well as the endangered Rothschild Giraffe. Dinner and overnight Lake Nakuru or Elementaita. Drive time approx: 3-5 hours, dependent on accommodation

Following an early breakfast, leaving the Rift Valley behind, proceed to Nairobi for an early lunch (or picnic lunch dependent on road conditions) and continue south towards Amboseli, arriving at your lodge by late afternoon. Dinner and overnight Camp or lodge on full board basis. Drive time approx: 7 hours, dependent on accommodation. Amboseli National Park is famous for its breathtaking views of Mount Kilimanjaro and large elephant herds. The park’s diverse landscapes include wetlands, savannah, and acacia woodlands, supporting abundant wildlife.
Morning and afternoon game drives in Amboseli, returning to the lodge as the sun sets. Dinner and overnight Camp or lodge on full board basis

Following an early breakfast, catch your last views of the majestic Mount Kilimanjaro as you depart Amboseli. From here, turn north across the beautiful and seemingly never ending Athi Plains, arriving in Kenya's bustling capital city of Nairobi by midday. Once in the city, clients will be dropped off in the city centre or at the airport for ongoing travel arrangements. Drive time approx: 4 hours

tourName: Kenya highlights safari
placesVisited: Lake Elementaita, Lake Nakuru National Park, Masai Mara, Luxury tented safari camps, Option for walking safari, Great wildebeest migration in season, Nairobi
generalInfo: Experience the ultimate safari adventure in Kenya – a week dedicated to spotting Africa’s most iconic wildlife. This classic trip takes us to the grassy plains of the Masai Mara, onto the hippo-populated waters of the Lake Naivasha, and through Amboseli National Park, known as the home of the African elephant. Along the way, our expert tour leader brings the animals and landscapes to life, while our specially adapted 4x4s allow everyone to have a window seat – you don’t want to miss any of the action.

dayInfo.description: Begin your adventure in Nairobi, the capital and largest city in Kenya. Many flights arrive late at night, so there are no activities planned today and our welcome briefing will take place tomorrow. If you do arrive earlier, the Nextgen shopping mall is next door to our hotel, which has a money exchange store and ATMs should you wish to exchange or withdraw money. Want more time in Nairobi? Secure pre-tour hotel nights through your sales representative. Accommodation: Eka Hotel (or similar)

After breakfast, say hi to your tour leader and fellow travellers, when we gather as a group to get to know each other and learn more about the adventures ahead. We begin our transfer (4hr 30min) to Amboseli National Park, with comfort stops along the way. Our journey takes us via the Athi-Kapiti plains. At the town of Sultan Hamud, we leave the paved road and turn south towards Amboseli. If the weather is clear, we should get good views of the Chyulu Hills to our left and Mount Kilimanjaro in front. We should also start to see many types of antelope, zebra and possibly giraffes. Also look out for the Maasai in their red shuka robes herding cattle and goats on the dusty plains. We have lunch on arrival at the lodge, then a little time to relax and explore the grounds, before an afternoon game drive. Amboseli is known as the home of the African elephant, but is also populated by leopards, cheetahs, giraffes, lions and crocodiles, plus more than 400 bird species. The setting is spectacular too with several different habitats, including the dried-out Lake Amboseli and savannah, plus Mount Kilimanjaro in the distance. After our exploration, we return to the lodge, where you can head to Hemingway’s Bar for uninterrupted views of the tallest mountain in Africa and a chance to reminisce on our first safari together. Accommodation: Amboseli Sopa Lodge (or similar)

Our wildlife-watching adventure in Amboseli continues today with two game drives, one in the morning and one in the afternoon. A second day in the park gives us time to explore areas not visited yesterday. We have lunch at a special site called Rocky Hill, which is run exclusively for guests of Amboseli Sopa Lodge. A second day here also significantly increases your chances of seeing some of the iconic animals. Accommodation: Amboseli Sopa Lodge (or similar)

Bid farewell to Amboseli after breakfast and transfer to Lake Naivasha. After four hours or so, we stop at the Carnivore Restaurant in Nairobi for lunch, where the chefs roast meats on traditional Maasai swords over a grand charcoal pit. Once you’ve had your fill, we transfer (two hours) to Lake Naivasha Sopa Lodge, arriving around 5pm. Enjoy an evening stroll along the lakeshore gardens before sundown and dinner. Accommodation: Lake Naivasha Sopa Resort (or similar)

Rise early for breakfast, then transfer to the lake for a one-hour boat safari. If we’re lucky, we will spot the resident hippo population, plus the majestic African fish eagle swooping from the trees. The safari adventure continues after, as we transfer (1hr 30min) to Lake Nakuru National Park, where we embark on a game drive upon arrival. The wildlife here is plentiful, including rhinos, hippos, giraffes, buffalo and abundant birdlife. We have lunch at our lodge for tonight, followed by another game drive, allowing us to further explore this haven for wildlife. Accommodation: Lake Nakuru Sopa Lodge (or similar)

Transfer (four hours) to the Masai Mara National Reserve after breakfast, regarded by many as Africa’s finest game park. After lunch at our lodge, we embark on our first game drive across the savannah, looking out for the abundant wildlife, which includes lions, elephants, rhinos, leopards and buffalo. Accommodation: Masai Mara Sopa Lodge (or similar)

We head back into the Masai Mara today, enjoying two game drives, one in the morning and another in the afternoon. Our second day lets us explore different sections of the park. On one game drive, we can visit a Maasai village (US$30, payable locally) for a glimpse into the life of this famous tribe. During the experience, we meet a village elder and are introduced to the rest of the villagers. We can also see traditional dwellings, watch cultural demonstrations and participate in an adumu, where dancers jump several feet high. You can also purchase traditional crafts. In the evening, we gather for one final dinner, an excellent chance to reminisce about our adventures together. Accommodation: Masai Mara Sopa Lodge (or similar)

Bid the Masai Mara farewell after breakfast. We then transfer (4hr 45min) to Nairobi, enjoying good views of the Rift Valley Escarpment on the way back. In Nairobi we arrive at the Eka Hotel, where day rooms are provided for the rest of the afternoon. The latest check out is 9pm and one buffet meal is included during this time. A group transfer to Nairobi Airport for onward flight arrangements is arranged in the early evening. Alternatively, if you'd like the ultimate East Africa wildlife-watching trip, speak to your sales representative about joining our Tanzania Safari Adventure.

tourName: Kenya holiday supporting community projects
generalInfo: On this 4-day cultural experience, you will join us for the opportunity to visit four grassroots Kenyan communities that travelers rarely have a chance to genuinely engage with. Take an active role in helping at some of the projects and meet the people who are coming together and bringing change to their social and economic welfare. Donate your time in a local soup kitchen, meet the strong and courageous women at a vocation and lifestyle training centre, and be inspired by some entrepreneurial Kenyan grandmothers. This experience will leave you humbled and heartened, and you will finish the tour by spending time with the Maasai and learn about their fascinating way of life that hasn’t changed for centuries.

dayInfo.description: Help at a Soup Kitchen. Getting involved in helping disadvantaged communities is both an opportunity to engage with local people and a rewarding way for travellers to contribute to alleviating the problems of poverty in Kenya. Today you visit a family centre on the outskirts of Nairobi which provides young children and their parents/guardians with a hot lunch. You lend a hand by helping to prepare and distribute nutritious food, and in return witness firsthand how communities work together to help the hungry and most vulnerable.

They Said It Cannot Be Done Spend an incredible day with some amazing Kenyan women who have managed to overcome the most difficult challenges that life can bring. You will visit a Women's Empowerment Centre where local women in the area undertake an 18-month program that teaches them lifestyle, trade and entrepreneurial skills so they can set up their own businesses. The experience of meeting these determined and resourceful women will allow you to walk away with a new perspective on how teaching empowerment and skills can lift people out of poverty to support and keep families together.

Grandmothers Love Their Pigs. Today you will visit another local community to meet some of the endearing and entrepreneurial Kenyan grandmothers who play a vital role in raising their grandchildren and providing a home and meals to many generations in their family. Visit a local grandmother’s pig farm and discover how pig-husbandry provides food and financial support and the bio-gas system creates energy out of the waste to power a home. Sit with the grandmothers and listen to their powerful stories of how they broke the cycle of poverty in between some joyful singing and dancing and a cup of local tea, and on this inspirational day you learn how resilient people can be.

Become a Maasai for the Day. Venture into rural Maasai country where you will meet a family and immerse yourself in the midst of the daily hustle and bustle of Maasai village life. Your host will be one of the village elders, an heir to his clan, and you meet his wife and children too. The male children of the family are young morans, the traditional defenders of the tribe. Learn about their traditional rites of passage while also discovering the intricacies of the Maasai family structure. An amazing day where you will get the chance to become an honorary Maasai, learn how to throw a traditional spear and the techniques needed to survive in the bush.

tourName: Kenya luxury family safari and beach holiday
generalInfo:
Experience three owner run properties, while covering three very different ecosystems and encountering their tribal inhabitants, whose authentic, traditional
and colourful tribal ways remain relatively untouched.
• On El Karama Ranch, explore 14,000 acres of private wilderness, frequented by
abundant wildlife.
• The El Karama’s Kids Bush School provides tailor made, educational safari
activities for all children throughout their stay.
• Enjoy the exclusivity of Enonkishu Conservancy, whose commitment to
sustainable rangeland management is encouraging more modern and more
viable livestock enterprises that support local communities.
• Considered the best beach in Kenya, Diani offers all of the activities of a beach
visit in the seclusion of a lavish, opulent private villa

dayInfo.description: Arrive Nairobi and transfer to your flight to Nanyuki for road transfer to El Karama Ranch for a 3 night stay. This award winning eco-lodge on 14,000 acres of private wilderness was designed, built and is operated by owners Murray and Sophie Grant. The lodge’s safari cottages and river side tents are dotted on the banks of the Ewaso Nyiro River; frequented by an abundance of wildlife, including four of the Big 5. With a passion for connecting all guests’ to the marvel of the natural world, the El Karama team value the importance of contributing to the long term sustainability of Laikipia. Interactive conservation projects for guests to involve themselves in are numerous, from monitoring lions to the reforestation of indigenous forests. Designed as a ‘home-away-from-home’ the passion for family, sustainability and home grown produce is prominent throughout El Karama; from farm to fork meals enjoyed by the eco swimming pool to tailor made Kids Bush School activities and adventure fly camping, El Karama is an ideal family safari destination.

Flight from Nanyuki to the Masai Mara, where you stay for 3 nights at House in the Wild. House in the Wild is a private family-owned and operated boutique lodge perched on the banks of the Mara River on the Enonkishu Conservancy. On what was once an intensive commercial farm on the northern edge of the Mara ecosystem, the rewilding project was the first of its kind where the land use on the edge of the Mara has reverted back to nature. Over the last ten years, the project has seen the range lands return to their natural state, with common sightings now of wild dog, leopard and of course the resident pride of lion on the base of the Kileleoni Hill. House in the Wild is hosted by the Wood family and their dedicated team of staff who are all from the local community. The mess area and four cottages offer the warmth and rustic charm of a family lodge, with all the home comforts you could ask for.

Fly from the Masai Mara to Ukunda, for 3 nights on Kenya's stunning coast. Alfajiri Villas provide privacy, exclusivity and luxury on Kenya’s famous Diani beach. Owner run and hosted, each opulent private villa has its own private swimming pool and access to the beach and warm water of the Indian Ocean. With delicious cuisine, the menus have a Mediterranean influence, with fresh produce sourced from local farms and of course the sea. Internationally recognised service is 24/7 and provided by a designated butler. Enjoy the magnificent views and swim in the pool of your private villa, walk on the ten kilometre-long white sandy beach, relax and enjoy a massage, go snorkelling on the edge of the coral reef, play golf at the 18-hole course nearby, visit the Shimba Hills National Reserve or explore the local craft markets. Guests can do as little or as much as they like, hosts Marica and Fabrizio plan individual daily itineraries for their guests.
Flight from Ukunda to Nairobi for your onward flight arrangements.

tourName: Kenya, Mara to the coast tour
generalInfo:
Kenya is without a doubt the most famous safari destination and rightly so, it has the vast plains and huge numbers of animals that other countries are frankly envious of. Often people who are seasoned visitors to East Africa are shocked when they visit other wildlife watching destinations around the world.

As well as the typical African safari species we will try and find some of the species that are often overlooked or unknown to the everyday safari goer.
This particularly happens during our time in the last of the three national parks, the little known Arabuko Sokoke Forest, here many of the animals are not found anywhere else and after seeing the more common species in the Mara and Tsavo we hope to find elusive species like the golden-rumped elephant-shrew, Sokoke bushy-tailed mongoose and Ader’s duiker.

But before we enter Sokoke we will explore the Mara and then the vast and under-developed Tsavo National Parks. In fact in Tsavo we could have most of the park to ourselves, as the park is seldom visited. Few parks the combination of vast size and few tourists, this means that the experience in Tsavo can be seen as a more ‘authentic’ safari and we do not know exactly what we will see here.

So join us on this four destination safari holiday to Kenya and experience the wild majesty of the Mara, West & East Tsavo and Sokoke Forest in all of their glory.

Introduction:

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife tours in Kenya which combine various different wildlife watching activities. In order to develop our unrivalled range of combined wildlife watching holidays, our guides and colleagues around the world have spent years searching out the world’s best wildlife watching locations as well as visiting some seldom visited areas. This dedication has led us to create this comprehensive safari which visits nearly all of the important wildlife watching locations within Kenya.

By visiting the grassland / savanna ecosystems of Masai Mara and Tsavo as well as the forest habitat of Sokoke you will combine the famous wildlife watching destinations with some of the lesser visited in Kenya. By visiting more than one protected area you will gain a larger appreciation for ecotourism and conservation matters, which is what makes this safari unique.

All of our tours are guided by our own professional zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) so you are sure to be in the best hands possible for the best sightings as well as a great network of local guides in East Africa who have developed a great range of wildlife watching locations where the rarest species are commonly seen. Also to try and make sure that we will see as many of the rarer and elusive animals such as hirola in Tsavo, elephant shrews and Ader's duiker in Sokoke as well as the famous Big Five in the Mara. On this trip we will spend many hours during the early morning and late afternoon on jeep safaris and also (where possible) after dark each night we will head out with high powered spotlights and start the search for nocturnal species.

One of the reasons why our wildlife watching holidays are unique is that our background (as a company) is from a scientific and zoological standpoint and so have a great network of colleagues and contacts all over the world who are the people on the front line in search of the best new locations for wildlife watching. All of these reasons and many more make us experts in arranging safaris and are able to tailor a safari to any location to try to find your targeted species. All you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go to try and find rare and elusive species.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner (where mentioned in the itinerary)). There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and open top 4x4 vehicles for all safaris. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) will escort you on all your excursions and also very knowledgeable English speaking local guides who have decades of experience working and guiding throughout Eastern Africa. Your zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) escort is an expert in mammal biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge of where some of the most elusive African animals are; as well as having years of experience in bringing people out to see Africa’s big five and its hundreds of other species safely. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, spotlighting drives, cultural performances, cultural activities, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the African bush or some other wildlife watching activity. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour.

Seasons:

We recommend September / October as a great time for this trip as the wildlife is abundant at this time of year and the weather is not too hot and drier than other times of year. But we can run the trip at other times of year; just note that the price quoted here is based on the low season, we can and do run this tour at other times of year, the wildebeest migration can also be included, please ask for specific quotes for different times of the year.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by a zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) as well as local naturalist guides, drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can offer you spotlighting trips around some of the places visited on the trip - where the local authorities allow after dark activities.
• We can also bring thermal imaging and night vision equipment as well as spotting scopes (on request) to also aid in finding the nocturnal mammals after dark and scan the horizon for harder to see species.
• We use camera traps (where available) which will increase the chances of getting close up pictures and movies of rare animals and other rare nocturnal wildlife.
• Explore a huge ranger of ecosystems and protected areas across two of the world's greatest wildlife watching destinations.
• Immerse yourself into the wonderful life of the Maasai and see how their famous coloured beads are made and also see how they and their cattle interact and live alongside the wildlife of the African plains and valleys.
• All the above reasons give this East African safari holiday a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here.
• We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Eastern Africa so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the Big Five, gorillas, chimpanzees and hundreds of other species throughout Eastern Africa. Whether it is the Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda or Rwanda or any of the other many wildlife watching locations you want to visit we can arrange it. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour travels to four locations, firstly the wonderful Masai Mara National Nature Reserve and then both Tsavo East and West National Parks (they adjoin each other) before Arabuko Sokoke Forest. The entrance point for this trip is Nariobi and the exit point is Mombasa.

Fitness Level:

The majority of wildlife watching is all done from the 4x4 safari vehicle so any fitness level can participate. There are very few walks involved and all do not require any special physical fitness.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old.

dayInfo.description: Nairobi - Arrival On your arrival into Nairobi airport you will be met by your local guide and driver and taken to your accommodation on the edge of this large city. If your arrival flight is early enough we can make it to the Mara today, otherwise it will be an early start for us to get to the Mara tomorrow. (no meals included today).

Masai Mara National Reserve - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning after an early breakfast at the hotel your guide will begin the journey southwest towards the border with Tanzania and the vast wild plains of the Maasi Mara / Serengeti ecosystem (~5 hours). The Masai Mara National Reserve is arguably the most famous wildlife watching destination in the world and home to some of the world’s most spectacular wildlife. As with the vast majority of wildlife around the world it is the early mornings and late afternoons which are the best for wildlife watching and so as the sun begins to get lower in the sky we will have the best chance of seeing lions and leopards. The reserve should still be playing (during September / October) host to around 1.7 million blue wildebeest, 260,000 plains zebra and 470,000 Thompson’s gazelles as they are at the end of their migration and spend the dry season in the Mara. Today will be more of a brief introduction to the Mara and we will be opportunistically trying and see anything of interest at the various waterholes and known locations for targeted species. (all meals included today)

Tsavo West National Park - Travelling & Wildlife Watching Very early this morning you will be collected from the lodge in the Mara to begin the journey to the first of the two Tsavo parks we will visit on this safari (~6 hours). The Tsavo ecosystem is an enormous, so large it is split into two national parks; the East Tsavo and West Tsavo we will first spend three nights in the West Tsavo National Park. Being the ‘smaller’ of the parks it still measures 9,065km2 and is home to huge numbers of wildlife. The journey to the park is likely to take all day to get to the park and so today you will be taken direct to the lodge for the night. (breakfast and dinner included today)

Tsavo West & East National Park - Wildlife Watching & Travelling Today we will have a final morning game drive of Tsavo West National Park before breakfast and then departing the relatively short distance to Tsavo East National Park, the parks are separated by A109 road that runs from Mombasa to Nairobi and a railway line. Once we arrive in the eastern side of the Tsavo ecosystem we will have another short game drive as we drive to our lodge, on arrival we will have lunch and then head out for our afternoon game drive once the temperatures cool a little as the day progresses. The eastern park is 13,747km2 in area and is drier than the western side, previously known as Taru Desert the area is not a true desert but more a semi arid ecosystem. The whole ecosystem (and the two national parks) were renamed Tsavo after the Tsavo River that flows through the park. The park is also a biodiversity hotspot and over the nest three full days we will spend lots of time looking for wildlife; there are some animals which are found here which are usually restricted to the very arid regions to the north and into Somalia, such as desert warthogs, somali ostriches and hirola. Once again we will have our evening meal back at the lodge amongst the sounds and sights of the African wilderness. (all meals included on these days).

Arabuko Sokoke National Park - Travelling & Spotlighting Today will be a long day of driving as we depart from the Tsavo East National Park and travel eastwards close to the Tanzanian border and towards the Indian Ocean. Our destination is the small forest remnant of Arabuko Sokoke National Park. We will arrive too late to enter the forest today for a safari but if you are not too tired we can look to arrange a short spotlighting trip around the border of the forest for mongooses, galagoes and hedgehogs. (breakfast and dinner included).

Mombasa - Travelling Today we will depart from Arabuko-Sokoke National Park in the morning and head the 110km south to Mombasa. Mombasa is Kenya’s second city and is located on the coast and we will head straight to our accommodation located along Daini beach and we will have the rest of the day to rest and relax before we head for home tomorrow. Being on the beach and looking out on the Indian Ocean it is great way to end the trip. We can visit a location along the coast to look for the Angolan colobus if you wish today. (breakfast and dinner included today).
Home - Travelling After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

tourName: Kenya migration and Manda Bay beach holiday
generalInfo:
The adventure begins the moment you step aboard your light aircraft in Nairobi. Soon you’re soaring over a patchwork of wilderness, dotted with acacia trees and winding rivers, before touching down in the legendary Masai Mara. Here, the drama of the Great Migration plays out on golden plains, with wildebeest and zebra thundering across the landscape in their millions.

Naibor Camp awaits, an elegant tented hideaway shaded by forest along the Talek River. Wake to birdsong and the low rumble of hippos, and drift off each night to the sounds of the bush. Days are filled with game drives led by expert guides, tracking big cats, elephants, and the ever-moving herds. Between July and October, you may even witness the most dramatic spectacle of all: wildebeest braving crocodile-filled rivers in their epic southward push.

For a truly unforgettable perspective, rise with the sun and float silently across the savannah in a hot air balloon. Watch the plains come alive with light and movement, then touch down for a champagne breakfast in the bush.

After the thrill of safari, it’s time to change pace. Fly north to Lamu, where you'll be met and whisked away across the water by boat to Manda Bay, Kenya’s ultimate barefoot luxury retreat. Shoes come off on arrival and won’t be needed again until you leave. Here, white sands meet turquoise seas, and days drift by in a haze of relaxation and adventure. Snorkel, sail, water-ski, or simply stretch out under the sun. As evening falls, take a dhow cruise into a fiery sunset or set off to explore the narrow streets of historic Lamu Town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site steeped in Swahili culture.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival into Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, a representative will be waiting to meet you and transfer you across town to Wilson Airport. Here. you'll board a light aircraft flight down to the Masai Mara. The flight itself is part of the adventure. In just under an hour you'll be gliding over the Great Rift Valley, with endless plains, winding rivers, and scatters acacias unfolding beneath you. It's the perfect introduction to the wilderness you're about to explore. Your guide from Naibor Camp will be ready to meet you at the airstrip. From there, enjoy your first game drive as you travel through the open savannah towards camp. Keep your eyes peeled - it's not unusual to encounter wildebeest, giraffe, or even big cats before you've even unpacked your bags. Naibor will be your home for the next four nights, a stunning tented camp perfectly located for exploring the Mara at its very best.

Explore this amazing part of Kenya over the next three days on game drives. From July to October, you'll be at the heart of the action as thousands of wildebeest and zebra make their perilous river crossings in the Mara, pursued by lions and lying in wait for crocodiles. It really is one of nature's most dramatic spectacles. As night falls, the bush transforms, alive with the sounds of nocturnal wildlife - so you will fall asleep to the Hippos in the river below you and quite often the not so far roar of a lion. The food here is absolutely excellent and you will certainly be impressed with their delicious meals. During your visit you can also visit a nearby Maasai village as well as enjoy a hot air balloon safari (optional extra)!

After a final morning in the Masai Mara, you’ll transfer to the airstrip for your short flight to Nairobi Wilson, taking a last look at the vast open plains below. From here, connect to your onward flight to Lamu. On arrival, a boat will whisk you across the water to Manda Bay, where barefoot luxury and six nights of pure relaxation await.

This is your time to unwind - stretch out on the beach, relax by the pool, and soak up the sunshine with a cocktail in hand. For those feeling adventurous, Manda Bay offers kite surfing, windsurfing, snorkelling, and fishing, along with the chance to explore the charm and history of nearby Lamu Town.

Savour your final morning in paradise, with time to relax and enjoy lunch before your flight back to Nairobi Wilson. On arrival, you’ll be met and transferred to Jomo Kenyatta International Airport for your onward journey home.

tourName: Kenya off the beaten track safari
generalInfo:
Discover a whole different side to one of the world's most beloved safari destinations by getting off the beaten path, participating in fly-camping and walking safaris, led by local guides in remote areas of intense natural beauty.

This unique itinerary takes you deep into the wilderness of Kenya's best wildlife-watching destinations: Laikipia, Samburu and the Masai Mara. You'll encounter safari favourites such as Africa's Big Five and big cats on the prowl, but you'll also be treated to exclusive experiences such as rhino tracking on foot with a local Samburu guide, as part of the Sera Conservancy's pioneering community-led conservation efforts.

A trip to Reteti Elephant Sanctuary offers a glimpse into why conservation is so important, as young orphaned elephants are looked after and reintroduced to the wild. On the cultural side, a visit to Fifty Wells offers a window into the lives of Kenya's local pastoralists, as they take their livestock to the natural springs to drink the water.

Explore Kenya's forgotten wild side on foot, led by camels and those who know the land best - the Maasai, the Samburu and the Turkana. Participate in game drives for a true safari experience, encountering big game in the wild. Then, relax at your safari accommodation with sundowners and stories around the campfire. This is the real Kenya.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Kenya - Arriving into Nairobi, you'll be met by a representative and transferred to the domestic airport, where you’ll board a light aircraft flight to Nanyuki. Your light aircraft flight is an experience in itself and you will have amazing views as you fly up towards the Laikipia Plateau. After landing, they'll be met by your guide and driven to your accommodation. You can expect to see elephant, giraffe, buffalo, hippo, Grevy’s zebra, warthog, hyenas, lions, bat-eared foxes and lots of antelope species. Laikipia also has excellent leopard sightings, striped hyena and some of the best wild dog sightings in Africa.

Explore Laikipia - Over the next two full days you’ll embark on an adventurous walking safari, fully supported by camels and led by experienced Maasai, Samburu, and Turkana walking guides. Laikipia is one of the only places in Kenya where you can go on a walking safari; travelling by camel rather than vehicle, you’ll access areas that vehicles cannot reach. You’ll be walking through breathtaking landscapes, tracking animals on foot and climbing hills and rocks for phenomenal views, before reaching your next camp. In the afternoon, you can relax at the camp, enjoy a swim in a nearby river or have a siesta, before going for an evening walk and sundowners. Your evening meal is cooked over the coals and you’ll eat under the stars.

Transfer to Samburu - Today, you’ll say goodbye to your camp before heading north. You’ll notice the landscape change around you as you enter Samburuland, the driest region of the country. For the next two nights you’ll stay at your accommodation in the heart of the Kalama Community Wildlife Conservancy. Leopard are often seen in the rocky outcrops surrounding the lodges and the Ewaso Nyiro river is home to Africa's most approachable elephants.

Explore Samburu - Enjoy a full day of exploring this stunning region. You can enjoy exciting morning, afternoon and night game drives and walking safaris with professional Samburu guides. Samburu National Reserve has a good number of lions, leopards, elephant, monkeys and impalas, as well as many wildlife species endemic to northern Kenya.
Rhino Tracking Experience - This morning you will be driven to the wild, undiscovered northern frontier of Kenya in the Sera Community Conservancy.

Reteti Elephant Sanctuary - Continue game drives and black rhino tracking in the sanctuary, plus you can visit Reteti Elephant Orphanage, which provides protection for orphaned and abandoned elephant calves, with an aim to release them back into the wild. We also recommend a visit to Fifty Wells, "Kisima Hamsini," a series of 50 springs where local pastoralists take their livestock to water, digging up water from the wells to fill up holders and troughs.

Transfer to Masai Mara - This morning you'll be driven to the airstrip, where you’ll take a light aircraft flight to the Masai Mara. Upon arrival at the Masai Mara you will be met by a representative and driven to your luxury safari lodge or camp, where you will stay for the next three nights. This afternoon, you’ll head out on your first game drive on the plains of the Masai Mara.

Explore the Masai Mara - Over the next two days, you’ll enjoy morning and afternoon game drives in the Masai Mara National Reserve. This iconic reserve offers amazing wildlife viewing opportunities and it’s highly likely that you’ll see zebra, impala, gazelle, wildebeest, buffalo, rhino and elephant, plus lions, cheetahs and leopards. Your lodge or camp may also offer the opportunity for a night game drive, where you’ll see nocturnal animals such as aardvarks and honey badgers. As well as game drives, there are a range of other activities that you can participate in during your time in the Masai Mara, including cultural visits to Maasai villages and markets, guided bush walks and black rhino tracking experiences.

Depart from Kenya - After breakfast, you’ll check out of your accommodation and you’ll be driven back to the airstrip for your light aircraft flight to Nairobi. You may wish to visit the endangered Rothschild giraffes at the Giraffe Centre in Lang'ata, or you can visit the Karen Blixen Museum. Alternatively, you may wish to consider fostering an elephant via the Sheldrick Wildlife Trust. Your driver will transfer you to Nairobi International Airport in the evening in time to catch your flight home.

tourName: Kenya private wildlife safari
generalInfo:
Nearly everyone who has ever seen a wildlife documentary will have seen some of the world famous rolling grasslands of the Masai Mara. This is Kenya’s premier protected areas and also one of the world’s most famous ecosystems. It has been the setting for countless wildlife documentaries and the reality more than lives up to the images shown on screen.

The iconic footage of lionesses chasing down a zebra, or the millions of blue wildebeest moving through the endless grassy plains and crossing the crocodile infested waters of the Mara River are synonymous with safaris. And what experiences they are to witness first hand.

However there is much more to Kenya than just the Masai Mara and this safari also visits the lesser known but equally wonderful Tsavo National Park a little further to the east along the border with Tanzania.

So join us on this two destination safari holiday to Kenya and experience the wild majesty of the Mara and Tsavo in all of their glory.

Introduction:

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife tours in Kenya which combine various different wildlife watching activities. In order to develop our unrivalled range of combined wildlife watching holidays, our guides and colleagues around the world have spent years searching out the world’s best wildlife watching locations as well as visiting some seldom visited areas. This dedication has led us to create this comprehensive safari which visits nearly all of the important wildlife watching locations within Kenya.

By visiting the grassland / savanna ecosystems of Masai Mara and Tsavo you will combine the famous wildlife watching destinations with some of the lesser visited in Kenya. By visiting more than one protected area you will gain a larger appreciation for ecotourism and conservation matters, which is what makes this safari unique.

All of our tours are guided by our own professional zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) so you are sure to be in the best hands possible for the best sightings as well as a great network of local guides in East Africa who have developed a great range of wildlife watching locations where the rarest species are commonly seen. Also to try and make sure that we will see as many of the rarer and elusive animals such as hirola in Tsavo as well as the famous Big Five in the Mara. On this trip we will spend many hours during the early morning and late afternoon on jeep safaris and also (where possible) after dark each night we will head out with high powered spotlights and start the search for nocturnal species.

One of the reasons why our wildlife watching holidays are unique is that our background (as a company) is from a scientific and zoological standpoint and so have a great network of colleagues and contacts all over the world who are the people on the front line in search of the best new locations for wildlife watching. All of these reasons and many more make us experts in arranging safaris and are able to tailor a safari to any location to try to find your targeted species. All you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go to try and find rare and elusive species.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner (where mentioned in the itinerary)). There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and open top 4x4 vehicles for all safaris. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) will escort you on all your excursions and also very knowledgeable English speaking local guides who have decades of experience working and guiding throughout Eastern Africa. Your zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) escort is an expert in mammal biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge of where some of the most elusive African animals are; as well as having years of experience in bringing people out to see Africa’s big five and its hundreds of other species safely. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, spotlighting drives, cultural performances, cultural activities, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the African bush or some other wildlife watching activity. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour.

Seasons:

We recommend September / October as a great time for this trip as the wildlife is abundant at this time of year and the weather is not too hot and drier than other times of year. But we can run the trip at other times of year; just note that the price quoted here is based on the low season, we can and do run this tour at other times of year, the wildebeest migration can also be included, please ask for specific quotes for different times of the year.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by a zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) as well as local naturalist guides, drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can offer you spotlighting trips around some of the places visited on the trip - where the local authorities allow after dark activities.
• We can also bring thermal imaging and night vision equipment as well as spotting scopes (on request) to also aid in finding the nocturnal mammals after dark and scan the horizon for harder to see species.
• We use camera traps (where available) which will increase the chances of getting close up pictures and movies of rare animals and other rare nocturnal wildlife.
• Explore a huge ranger of ecosystems and protected areas across two of the world's greatest wildlife watching destinations.
• Immerse yourself into the wonderful life of the Maasai and see how their famous coloured beads are made and also see how they and their cattle interact and live alongside the wildlife of the African plains and valleys.
• All the above reasons give this East African safari holiday a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here.
• We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Eastern Africa so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the Big Five, gorillas, chimpanzees and hundreds of other species throughout Eastern Africa. Whether it is the Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda or Rwanda or any of the other many wildlife watching locations you want to visit we can arrange it. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour travels to two locations, firstly the wonderful Masai Mara National Nature Reserve and then both Tsavo East and West National Parks (they adjoin each other) and the entrance and exit point for this trip is Nairobi.

Fitness Level:

The majority of wildlife watching is all done from the 4x4 safari vehicle so any fitness level can participate. There are very few walks involved and all do not require any special physical fitness.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old.

dayInfo.description: Nairobi - Arrival On your arrival into Nairobi airport you will be met by your local guide and driver and taken to your accommodation on the edge of this large city. If your arrival flight is early enough we can make it to the Mara today, otherwise it will be an early start for us to get to the Mara tomorrow. (no meals included today).

Masai Mara National Reserve - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning after an early breakfast at the hotel your guide will begin the journey southwest towards the border with Tanzania and the vast wild plains of the Maasi Mara / Serengeti ecosystem (~5 hours). The Masai Mara National Reserve is arguably the most famous wildlife watching destination in the world and home to some of the world’s most spectacular wildlife. As with the vast majority of wildlife around the world it is the early mornings and late afternoons which are the best for wildlife watching and so as the sun begins to get lower in the sky we will have the best chance of seeing lions and leopards. The reserve should still be playing (during September / October) host to around 1.7 million blue wildebeest, 260,000 plains zebra and 470,000 Thompson’s gazelles as they are at the end of their migration and spend the dry season in the Mara. Today will be more of a brief introduction to the Mara and we will be opportunistically trying and see anything of interest at the various waterholes and known locations for targeted species. (all meals included today)

Tsavo West National Park - Travelling & Wildlife Watching Very early this morning you will be collected from the lodge in the Mara to begin the journey to the first of the two Tsavo parks we will visit on this safari (~6 hours). The Tsavo ecosystem is an enormous, so large it is split into two national parks; the East Tsavo and West Tsavo we will first spend three nights in the West Tsavo National Park. Being the ‘smaller’ of the parks it still measures 9,065km2 and is home to huge numbers of wildlife. The journey to the park is likely to take all day to get to the park and so today you will be taken direct to the lodge for the night. (breakfast and dinner included today)

Tsavo West & East National Park - Wildlife Watching & Travelling Today we will have a final morning game drive of Tsavo West National Park before breakfast and then departing the relatively short distance to Tsavo East National Park, the parks are separated by A109 road that runs from Mombasa to Nairobi and a railway line. Once we arrive in the eastern side of the Tsavo ecosystem we will have another short game drive as we drive to our lodge, on arrival we will have lunch and then head out for our afternoon game drive once the temperatures cool a little as the day progresses. The eastern park is 13,747km2 in area and is drier than the western side, previously known as Taru Desert the area is not a true desert but more a semi arid ecosystem. The whole ecosystem (and the two national parks) were renamed Tsavo after the Tsavo River that flows through the park. The park is also a biodiversity hotspot and over the nest three full days we will spend lots of time looking for wildlife; there are some animals which are found here which are usually restricted to the very arid regions to the north and into Somalia, such as desert warthogs, somali ostriches and hirola. Once again we will have our evening meal back at the lodge amongst the sounds and sights of the African wilderness. (all meals included on these days).

Nairobi - Travelling This morning will be an early start again as we depart back towards Nairobi. Today will be a day spent driving and on arrival at the hotel you will have the rest of the day at rest. (breakfast is the only meal included today)
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today).

tourName: Kenya's big five safari and beach honeymoon
generalInfo:
Few honeymoon experiences can match the thrill and romance of a Kenyan safari followed by time on the Indian Ocean’s white sand beaches. Kenya offers one of the best safari and beach combinations in Africa, with superb wildlife, dramatic landscapes, and palm-fringed shores.

Your journey begins with a night in Nairobi, staying near Wilson Airport to allow an easy start the next morning. From here, fly to the Samburu National Reserve, known for its striking landscapes, excellent elephant sightings and rich cultural encounters. After a few days exploring this dramatic region, fly south to the legendary Maasai Mara - famous for its big cats, sweeping plains, and some of the best guiding in Africa.

To complete your honeymoon, head to Diani Beach on the Kenyan coast. Here, spend your days unwinding in the sun, swimming in turquoise waters, and dining on fresh seafood before returning to Nairobi for your flight home.

dayInfo.description: On arrival in Nairobi, you’ll be met at the airport and transferred to Ole Sereni Hotel, conveniently located nearby, for your first night in Kenya.

After breakfast, you'll be transferred to Wilson Airport for a scenic light aircraft flight north to the striking landscapes of Samburu National Reserve. A short drive takes you to Saruni Samburu, your base for the next three nights. Settle into your spacious villa, enjoy lunch with a view, and take time to unwind before heading out on your first afternoon game drive. Samburu is known for its dramatic scenery and excellent elephant sightings, along with a host of other unique wildlife.

As dawn breaks over Samburu, you’ll be greeted with tea and coffee before setting off to explore the reserve in the soft morning light. Watch predators retreating into the bush after a night of hunting, spot herds of antelope basking in the warmth of the sun, and soak in the serene tranquillity of the Samburu mornings. Between activities, relax by the infinity pool, enjoy the sunshine, and experience the warm hospitality of the staff. The food at Saruni Samburu is a highlight, with dishes crafted from seasonal, locally sourced ingredients.

One of the hardest decisions during your stay at Saruni Samburu is choosing which activity to try next. In addition to traditional game drives, you can enjoy guided walks to get up close to the smaller wildlife and learn about the diverse trees and plants of the region. You can also visit a local elephant sanctuary, experience the culture of a traditional Samburu village, and explore ancient rock art in hidden caves. For something extra special, Saruni Samburu offers helicopter trips over the reserve, complete with sundowners - an unforgettable way to take in the stunning landscape.

After a final breakfast on the terrace with views over the plains, you’ll be transferred to the airstrip for a light aircraft flight to the Maasai Mara. Upon arrival, a short transfer will take you through the reserve to Saruni Mara, nestled in the exclusive Mara North Conservancy, which borders the main Maasai Mara National Reserve. Here, you’ll enjoy exceptional game viewing in a quieter, privately managed area - an ideal setting for an unforgettable safari experience.

Spend the day with your highly experienced guide, immersing yourself in the exceptional game viewing that the Mara is known for. The region is famous for its excellent lion and leopard sightings, with large herds of plains game offering thrilling hunting opportunities. Elephant sightings are frequent, and iconic animals like giraffe and zebra are abundant. Honeymooners visiting between August and October will have the chance to explore the main reserve, witnessing the awe-inspiring Great Migration and, if lucky, one of the dramatic river crossings.
