With plenty of opportunities for long, exhilarating canters and jumping obstacles, this is a highlight of the ride. As we return toward the Ewaso Nyiro River, we cross onto the scenic Ol Donyo Lemboro Ranch. Arrive at Laikipia Wilderness Camp in time for lunch, then enjoy an afternoon game drive or a guided walk through the bush. This area is prime for tracking wild dogs, and encountering them on foot is an unforgettable thrill. The region is also renowned for sightings of the elusive melanistic (black) leopard - another rare and exciting experience. Riding time: approx. 3 hours

This morning, you will set off early into the stunning and untouched Mutara Valley, winding through this ‘Garden of Eden’ along a seasonal riverbed. As you ride, you are likely to encounter giraffes, elephants, eland, and buffalo, among other wildlife. We’ll pause for a bush breakfast under the shade of a large acacia tree, with plenty of fresh water for the horses. After breakfast, complete the final leg of our journey, passing seasonal marshlands as we head back to Sosian, arriving in time for a refreshing lunch by the pool. In the afternoon, unwind and relax, then enjoy an evening game drive or camel ride to sundowners, followed by a bush dinner around the campfire. If you're lucky, you might even spot a leopard on the way back to the lodge. Riding time: approx. 4 hours

Today is yours to enjoy at your own pace. For those eager to ride, a morning on the cross-country course offers plenty of fun, or if the dams are full, swimming with the horses is a unique experience. You can also explore the area by jumping off waterfalls, kayaking, mountain biking, or even experiencing cattle ranching. If you prefer to take it easy, simply relax by the pool and soak in the surroundings. Riding time: approx. 4 hours
Time to say Kwaheri (goodbye)! After a final breakfast at the lodge, you'll head back to Nairobi, arriving in time for your international flight home.

tourName: Lewa Safari Marathon, Kenya
generalInfo:
Embark on an extraordinary adventure where you'll immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty of Kenya's Lewa Conservancy while challenging yourself in the iconic Lewa Safari Marathon.

This one-of-a-kind experience combines the thrill of an incredible safari odyssey with the exhilaration of participating in a truly unique running event. As you navigate the dirt tracks and trails winding through the conservancy, you'll find yourself amidst a living tapestry of grazing zebras, towering giraffes, and majestic antelope herds. Unlike conventional city marathons, the Lewa Safari Marathon offers an unforgettable twist – the potential to encounter the awe-inspiring presence of elephants or lions crossing your path!

Established in 2000 as a fundraising initiative, this annual event has grown to become a beacon of support for Lewa's conservation efforts and community development projects in the region. With over 1,000 local and international runners seeking a uniquely wildlife-filled African running experience, the Lewa Safari Marathon has played a crucial role in generating millions of dollars to protect Lewa's precious wildlife and ecosystems over the past two decades.

Prepare to be captivated by the raw beauty of nature as you push your limits in this extraordinary race, all while contributing to a noble cause that safeguards the rich biodiversity of this remarkable corner of the world

“One of the top ten races to run in your life” – Runner’s World

dayInfo.description: Thursday 25th June - Head for Nairobi Begin your journey with a direct flight to Nairobi, Kenya's vibrant capital. Upon arrival, you'll be greeted by our local representative who will ensure a hassle-free transfer to the Tamarind Tree Hotel, your comfortable abode for the night. Relax and rejuvenate before embarking on your African adventure.

Friday 26th June – Head for Lewa Fuel up with a hearty breakfast before embarking on a journey from Nairobi to Nanyuki, nestled at the foot of the majestic Mount Kenya. Upon arriving in Nanyuki, your tour leader will provide a comprehensive briefing, followed by a special session with Stephen Kamar, a former international marathon runner with an impressive personal best of 2:10. Tap into his expertise as he shares invaluable tips and insights about the upcoming Lewa Marathon course. Then, embark on a scenic 2.5-hour journey through the stunning landscapes of Mount Kenya, ultimately descending into the Lewa Wildlife Conservancy – the home of the Lewa Marathon and a premier wildlife viewing destination. Traveling in well-equipped 4x4 safari vehicles, you'll experience the thrill of off-road adventure while immersing yourself in the region's natural splendor. After arrival, you'll complete the race registration formalities and collect your race numbers. Then, gather around the crackling campfire to savor a delicious meal and retire for a restful night, energized for the exciting adventures that lie ahead.

Saturday 27th June - Race Day Wake up to the tranquil sounds of nature as the sun rises over the marathon campsite. After a quick breakfast around 6 AM, make your way to the starting line, where an unforgettable experience awaits at 7 AM. As the first rays of dawn paint the sky, the scenic Lewa Safari Marathon will commence, taking you on a breathtaking journey through the beautiful Lewa landscapes. With the majestic Mount Kenya as your backdrop, prepare to be inspired by world-class vistas as you run alongside knowledgeable rangers who ensure your safety, even in the presence of wildlife. Embrace the opportunity to connect with nature in a truly unique way. After crossing the finish line, it's time to pack up the camp and embark on a two-hour drive to The Safari Series tented camp nestled in the stunning Loldaiga Hills. Upon arrival in the afternoon, you'll have the opportunity to unwind or optionally partake in a thrilling game drive, immersing yourself in the region's rich wildlife. As the day draws to a close, retreat to your en-suite tents, where a well-deserved restful night awaits, allowing you to recharge and prepare for the adventures that lie ahead.

Sunday 28th June - Safari Life with Safari Series Embrace the essence of an authentic safari experience as you embark on a full day of exhilarating activities from your tented camp base. Start your day by witnessing the breathtaking sight of the sun's first rays illuminating the iconic snow-capped peak of Mount Kenya from the vantage point of the Loldaiga Hills. After basking in the golden morning light, venture out on an unforgettable game drive across the lush savannah of the conservation area. Keep your eyes peeled for a diverse array of wildlife, including majestic giraffes, mighty elephants, elusive lions, endangered wild dogs, powerful rhinos, formidable buffaloes, and graceful antelopes. Around mid-morning, pause for a delightful "brunch in the bush" experience, where you'll dine al fresco, surrounded by the sights and sounds of nature. Afterward, continue your thrilling game drive until the sun begins to set, painting the sky with vibrant hues. As the day draws to a close, indulge in a refreshing cocktail while listening to the wilderness awaken for the evening. Savor the serene ambiance as the nocturnal symphony unfolds, providing the perfect finale to an incredible day immersed in the heart of the African safari.

Monday 29th June - Morning Game Drive Begin your day with one last exhilarating game drive, soaking in the sights and sounds of the wilderness one final time. Afterward, gather for a hearty lunch at The Safari Series, where you'll have the opportunity to bid farewell to your gracious hosts and reflect on the incredible memories created during your adventure-filled long weekend. Embark on a journey back to Nairobi, reminiscing about the unforgettable experiences and cherished moments as you travel in the comfort of your 4x4 vehicles. Upon reaching the vibrant capital city, celebrate your accomplishment at the Lewa Marathon with a final dinner together, raising a toast to the extraordinary adventure you've shared. As the evening draws to a close, it's time to make your way to Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, where you'll board your overnight flights back home with British Airways, carrying with you a lifetime of memories from this remarkable African escapade.

Tuesday 30th June: Overnight flight As your flight touches down in the UK, a sense of accomplishment and nostalgia washes over you. With the African adventure now etched into your memories, you'll have the choice to either make your way home, basking in the afterglow of the incredible experiences, or proceed directly to the office. Imagine the looks on your colleagues' faces when they inquire, 'How was your weekend? Did you do anything out of the ordinary?' This will be your moment to regale them with tales of your extraordinary journey – from conquering the scenic Lewa Safari Marathon against the backdrop of Mount Kenya's majestic peaks, to embarking on thrilling game drives through the lush savannahs, witnessing majestic wildlife in their natural habitats.

tourName: Luxury Kenya and Tanzania safari with Zanzibar
generalInfo:
Our Classic Luxury & Thrilling Kenya, Tanzania and Zanzibar is choreographed in mind of among the finest, award winning properties and attractions in East Africa making sure that our upmarket clients get to enjoy the finest experiences in the region.

From the first time they touch down at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport in Nairobi to the time they leave at Zanzibar Airport, high end VIP services are guaranteed.

Our particular selection of a wide array of luxury accommodation properties in East Africa ensure that the guest is able to enjoy game drives and other attractions in the region hassle free at exceptional service and utmost comfort with great services such as butler service in some of the properties, golfing, unlimited tailor-made game drives, walking safaris, cultural visits, beach sports which make the adventure worthwhile.

dayInfo.description: NAIROBI- ARRIVAL JAMBO! Upon arrival at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport in Nairobi, you will be met by Classic Journeys Africa Customer Care Representative who will assist you with the transfer to your luxury hotel. Before checking in at hotel, he will brief you on your program ahead and introduce the Driver Guide who will be with you throughout the safari

NAIROBI After your morning rest start off at your Nairobi excursions where you will proceed to the AFEW Giraffe Center, visit a nature center run by the African Fund for Endangered Wildlife. Visit the Daphne Sheldrick Elephant Orphanage. This is a nursery and rehab center for infant elephants that have lost their families, as well as the occasional rhino, zebra and other wildlife. These infants are eventually released into the wild at Tsavo East National Park and end up in the care of other orphans who have been successfully reintroduced to the wild. Lunch will be at Utamanduni Craft Centre as you shop for souvenirs. Visit Karen Blixen Museum famous for the award-winning movie “Out of Africa”. Visit to Kazuri beads factory where you can buy some bead work and other souvenirs as you see how they are made. You will be transferred to your hotel for freshening before going for dinner at the Carnivore Restaurant, “Africa’s best eating experience”, famous for its mouthwatering charcoal grilled barbecue

MT. KENYA After breakfast, drive to Mount Kenya to arrive in time for lunch at your resort. With magnificent views of majestic Mount Kenya, your resort offers a unique blend of comfort, relaxation and adventure. Arrive in time for lunch at the Club in the afternoon visit the Mount Kenya Wildlife Conservancy which was established in 1967 by the Hollywood actor, William Holden, Julian McKeand and Iris and Don Hunt. The Conservancy also hosts a herd of rare white zebras, shelters orphaned or wounded animals and provides a wide-reaching educational program for young Kenyans. Mt. Kenya Wildlife Conservancy gives orphaned, injured, neglected, abused or frightened wild animals a second chance. The orphanage provides shelter and professional care with the goal to release these creatures back to the wild where they belong. Its known for bongo breeding program and protection of the rare white zebra

OLPEJETA CONSERVANCY This morning depart to the privately-owned 24,000 acre reserve, Ol Pejeta Conservancy for a full day game viewing in the conservancy with magnificent views of Mt. Kenya. Enjoy a morning game viewing, lunch will be at Ol Pejeta Conservancy followed by an afternoon game viewing drive. One of only four private wildlife reserves in Kenya, your experience includes wildlife drives in search of the ‘Big Five’. This afternoon you will also visit the 200-acre Chimpanzee sanctuary that has been set up here as well as the Rhino Sanctuary. Later return to your club for an optional around of golf or other club activities, dinner and overnight.

MASAI MARA NATIONAL RESERVE After breakfast and a short briefing by your driver guide fly to the world-famous Masai Mara National Reserve, backdrop to 'the greatest wildlife spectacle on earth', the annual migration of over one million wildebeest. You will arrive Masai Mara in time for a short noon game drive, lunch followed by an afternoon game viewing drive in Kenya's most popular reserve. Go back in camp in time for campfire cocktails and dinner.

MARA NATIONAL RESERVE Your day will be spent on safari in Africa's richest wildlife viewing arena. Historically teeming with wildlife, the Mara hosts Kenya's largest lion prides and elephant herds. Other predators include leopard, cheetah and spotted hyena; while in the Mara River you will see fat pods of hippo and vast Nile crocodiles. Other highlights include giraffe tops, gazelle, zebra, buffalo and over 550 species of birds. Take the opportunity to fly over the Mara in a Hot air Balloon at an extra cost. The balloon package includes a champagne breakfast in the wild! If you can spare the money, viewing abundant game afloat a balloon is an unforgettable experience. Alternatively visit a Masai village and get learn the Masai culture at an extra cost.

SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK After breakfast this morning you will be transferred to the Airstrip at 0910hrs where you will fly Migori arriving at 0930hrs. Upon arrival at Migori you will have a 30 minute road transfer to Isebania Immigrations and customs office then clear with the Immigration officials. At 1045hrs you will depart from Tarime airstrip arriving Serengeti~ Seronera airstrip at 1105hrs where your Tanzania guides will be eagerly waiting for you. You will be transferred to Four Seasons Serengeti with a game viewing en route. Lunch will be at your lodge followed by relaxation .Later enjoy an afternoon classic safari supper in the Serengeti National Park.

SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK After breakfast, enjoy two full days game driving (meals taken in true safari style ‘in the bush’) in the vast and sensational Serengeti, which covers 14,763 sq km of endlessly rolling savannah. Venue for ‘the greatest wildlife show on Earth’, the annual migration of over one million wildebeest, the park is also renowned for its lions, cheetahs, zebras, giraffes and plains game. Overnight at your lodge.

ZANZIBAR BEACH STAY This morning breakfast will be at your lodge before flying to Zanzibar at 1100hrs to arrive Zanzibar 1250hrs awhere you will be transferred to your hotel. Your days will be spent at a unique beach 5-Star resort located on the East coast of Zanzibar Island at the famous Pongwe beach. The independent resort was opened in 2015 and sets the standard for luxury on the Zanzibar Island. All 16 villas are designed to reflect the spirit of Zanzibar. The resort offers many complimentary services and activities for all clients. The resort was awarded with title of TripAdvisor Excellency, won the World Luxury Hotel Awards 2017 as The Best Luxury Beach Resort in Tanzania and Zanzibar and also is proud member of Pure society of ‘PUREists’ who are true mavericks, united by their mission to Change Worlds by catalyzing adventure, fostering personal connections and encouraging a conscientious approach to the environment and local communities. For ocean lovers, the choices range from diving to snorkeling, fishing and sailing trips. Some of these are provided in traditional Dhows and powerful speed boats. Sea-excursions can take place from just about anywhere on the Island. The most popular excursions which can be arranged for you at an extra cost are: The Spice Tour: - Zanzibar, for centuries famed for its cloves, is still the pre-eminent spice market of eastern Africa. This tour enables guests to touch, smell and tastes a whole world of spices. Stone Town Tour: This tour takes you to the historical Stone Town, famous for its intricate architecture and rich history. The excursion includes visits to the town market, the Tipu Tip House (where once lived one of Africa’s most colorful buccaneer), the Slave Market (that was the centre of east Africa’s slave trade) the unforgettable Slave Chambers, the National Museum, the High Court of Zanzibar, the Sultans Palace, the House of Wonders and the Old Fort. The land excursions will acquaint you with the history, culture, fauna and flora of this pristine Island whilst the Indian Ocean presents a wonderful opportunity for sea-excursions. Jozani Forest Tour: This tour will take you tothe south east of Zanzibar, right at the heart a beautiful green mangroves forest. The forest is home to a number of endemic species, including the rare Zanzibar Red Colobus monkey. Dolphin Adventure: This excursion diverts to the southern tip of the Island where Bottlenose and Spinner Dolphins are frequently seen. The trip doubles as an exceptional opportunity to snorkel or just swim in the Indian Ocean. Lunch of a variety of local and seafood dishes is served in one of the many small restaurants on the beach. The Blue Safaris: This adventurous excursion will take you in a motorized dhow to the south west of the Island. The trip will take you to the mangroves forest, then on to one of the many sand banks for snorkeling before making a stop on the famous Kwale Island where your chance of making new acquaintances with Dolphins is a remarkable 85%. Lunch on the Island is a sumptuous BBQ affair with local specialties and a choice of homemade local sauces. Late afternoon offers a choice of further snorkeling, swimming or just relaxing

DEPARTURE Today you will spend the day at leisure enjoying the facilities at the hotel. Later you will be transferred to Zanzibar Airport for your flight back home. Say good bye to the wonderful country and promise to join us on another expedition!

tourName: Luxury Kenya safari
generalInfo:
An unforgettable safari taking you into the heart of Africa’s most spectacular wildlife areas. You will be fully immersed in the heart of the action, in the best game viewing areas of the Masai Mara, Laikipia and the Great Rift Valley in Kenya.

The Safari offers 2 nights full board accommodation at Loldia House in the Great Rift Valley, followed by 2 nights at Governors’ Mugie House on Private Ranch in Laikipia with all activities provided on the ranch and the Conservation fee for Mugie Ranch included. A a 4 night stay at one of the Governors’ Camps in the Masai Mara with daily morning & evening game drives with expert guides, and internal flights to/from the camp.

dayInfo.description: Met on arrival at Nairobi Airport and transfer to your Hotel for an overnight stay on a bed and breakfast basis.

Pick up from your hotel and transfer by road (approximately a 2hr drive) through the scenically beautiful Great Rift Valley down to Loldia House, nestling on the shores of Lake Naivasha. Enjoy a delicious lunch, al fresco style, on the lawn overlooking the lake and with Mt Longonot in the distance.

Todau you can either opt for a full day’s activities on Loldia Ranch; these include birdwatching and boat trips on Lake Naivasha, visits to the local flower farm and night game drives. Alternatively, you can have a early morning start and head off to Lake Nakuru National Park with a packed breakfast. Enjoy a morning game drive around Lake Nakuru, famous for its abundance of flamingos and a large variety of water birds.

Enjoy breakfast at Loldia, before heading off on a very scenic drive (approx. 4 hours) up to Kenya’s Northern Frontier District, where a delicious lunch will be waiting for you at Governors’ Mugie House. Depending on what you feel like doing, you can either head out on your first afternoon game drive and explore this pristine wilderness (which is home to some of Kenya’s northern rangeland species), lay by the pool, enjoy the hide overlooking the waterhole, indulge in some spa treatments or enjoy a siesta. Pre-dinner drinks around a fire, dinner and overnight at Governors’ Mugie House.

Activities at Mugie Conservancy, from traditional game drives to canoeing on Mugie Dam (elephants might decide to take a playful dip beside you), to bush walks, bush meals and fishing on the Mugie Dam.

Take a short light aircraft flight to your Masai Mara camp. Enjoy a game drive en route to the camp, followed by an alfresco lunch served overlooking the Masai Mara plains. In the afternoon game drive across the Mara plains before returning to camp at sundown. Pre-dinner drinks around the campfire, a candlelit dinner in the dining tent or around a blazing campfire and overnight at Governors’ Camp.

Early morning game drive at dawn, returning to the Camp for a full breakfast, served in the shade of the camp’s indigenous riverine forest. There are no set times at Governors’ Camps. After breakfast there is the opportunity to take a game drive along the banks of the Mara River, or to visit some of our responsible tourism initiatives – the world’s first bio gas plant in a Masai Manyatta and also visit the Mara Rianda Primary School. Return to Governors’ Camp for a delicious lunch overlooking the rolling Mara Plains. Later, depart on an afternoon game drive enjoying some of Africa’s best game viewing. Return to camp before sundown, and relax around the campfire before enjoying the evenings’ fine dining.
Days spent exploring the Masai Mara Game Reserve and all that it has to offer. Dinner and overnight at Governors’ Camp.
Arise for your last early morning dawn game drive, returning to camp for a leisurely long breakfast in camp, before taking your flight back to Nairobi and onward arrangements.

tourName: Luxury Masai Mara Safari & Zanzibar Honeymoon
placesVisited: Masai Mara conservancy game drives, Luxury safari lodge, scenic flight back to Nairobi, beachfront villa at a five-star hotel in Zanzibar
generalInfo:
If you are looking to relax, kick back and recover from the stresses of wedding planning then this Masai Mara and Zanzibar honeymoon is for you. Featuring cocktails by the pool, elephants by the waterhole, sunsets at the beach: sit back and watch as this trip gives you an audience with some of the greatest natural spectacles on earth, plus time to chill out afterwards.

After a couple of days in Nairobi, you’ll fly to the Masai Mara, to a luxurious tented camp that has its own pool. Here you can enjoy twice daily game drives – it’s possible to see the Great Migration here – and enjoy bush walks and even hot air balloon flights. You might wake up, open your tent door and see a warthog family outside.

Three days later you take a scenic flight from the Masai Mara to Nairobi, and from here fly on to Zanzibar. You’ll be driven to its east coast, to a luxurious resort. Expect a hotel on a fantastic stretch of beach that even has its own PADI dive centre. You have seven nights here: meaning you can get a diving qualification, see lots of the island, or just chill out – the perfect start to your new life together.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Kenya Fly into Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, where you will be picked up by your driver and transferred to The Karen Residence on the edge of Nairobi where you will stay for two nights on a bed and breakfast basis.

Explore Nairobi Your adventure begins as your driver picks you up from your hotel. You'll have the morning to explore Nairobi, starting with a visit to the Giraffe Sanctuary and the Elephant Orphanage. Afterward, enjoy a delicious lunch at the Karen Blixen Coffee Garden. In the afternoon, return to The Karen Residence, where you can unwind in the garden or lounge by the pool.

Safari Time Following breakfast, you'll be picked up and driven to Nairobi Wilson Airport to catch the 10am flight bound for the Mara. Upon landing at 11am, your guide from Kichwa Tembo will be there to greet you, marking the start of your safari experience. You'll spend three nights in the luxurious Kichwa Tembo Tented Camp, staying in a Superior Tent and enjoying full board accommodation. Make the most of their Honeymoon Special Offer, ensuring your stay is nothing short of magical.

Explore the Masai Mara Embark on twice-daily game drives, with common sightings including lions, elephants, cheetahs, and zebras. During your downtime, unwind by the pool, offering breathtaking views over the Mara plains. For those seeking adventure, consider trying a Balloon Safari over the Mara or exploring the vast landscapes on horseback—experiences that promise memories of a lifetime.

The beach awaits Following a morning game drive, you'll catch the 11am flight from the Masai Mara back to Nairobi, connecting you to your flight to Zanzibar. Upon landing at 3.45pm, a driver will be waiting to transfer you to the East Coast. Around 5pm, you'll arrive at the White Sands Luxury Villas and Spa, where you'll check into your luxurious Deluxe Room where you will be staying for the next eight nights on a half board basis. If you're not already relaxed, this idyllic retreat is sure to work its magic!

And relax... Enjoy your private pool or explore the resort's stunning pool nestled amidst the beautiful surroundings. Breakfast and lunch are served in the main restaurant, while dinner locations vary within the resort, offering a diverse culinary experience. Try a range of onsite activities such as wine tasting and language lessons, or pamper yourself with rejuvenating treatments at the onsite spa. With a host of options available, you could easily spend all eight days within the resort. Should you wish to venture beyond the resort, the hotel reception can assist in arranging boat trips, tours of Stone Town - a historic hub once known as the slave trade capital of the world- scuba diving expeditions, or visits to the enchanting Jozani Forest Reserve.
Home time After checkout you will be picked up by a driver and head to Zanzibar International Airport to catch your flight home.

tourName: Maasai Mara wildlife photography holiday
generalInfo:
Once a year, the Maasai Mara transforms into the heart of one of nature’s most dramatic events: the Great Migration. During this season, immense herds of wildebeest and zebra surge across the Mara River, triggering intense predator activity and offering extraordinary opportunities for wildlife photography. It’s a time of heightened energy and raw spectacle, and it’s precisely when we invite you to join us for a photographic and conservation-focused safari experience.

This journey is designed for those who want more than just a glimpse of wildlife - it’s for storytellers, conservation enthusiasts, and photographers seeking depth, variety, and meaning. The itinerary includes time in three distinct regions of the Mara ecosystem: the Mara Triangle, known for its classic savannah landscapes and dramatic river crossings; the Pardamat Conservation Area, a community-led initiative where wildlife and people share the land; and the private Naboisho Conservancy, renowned for its predator density and off-road freedom. Each location offers a unique perspective and contributes to a richer, more layered photographic narrative.

Group sizes are kept small to ensure flexibility and intimacy. There’s no pressure to rush from sighting to sightin; instead, you’ll have the freedom to wait for the right moment, observe animal behavior, and capture images that tell a deeper story. Whether it’s the tension before a river crossing, the quiet connection between a mother and calf, or the golden light falling across the plains, you’ll have time to respond to the scene with intention.

Throughout the safari, professional photographic guidance is available from Sam Turley, a seasoned wildlife photographer with a deep understanding of the Mara and its rhythms. Sam offers support both in the field and during optional editing sessions, helping you refine your technique and elevate your storytelling. His approach is collaborative and insightful, tailored to your experience level and creative goals.

Beyond photography, this experience offers meaningful engagement with conservation efforts and local communities. You’ll meet Maasai leaders and conservation teams working to protect wildlife and support sustainable livelihoods. These interactions provide context and connection, helping you understand the challenges and successes of coexistence in one of Africa’s most vital ecosystems.

This is not a standard safari. It’s a chance to create powerful imagery, gain insight into conservation in action, and experience the Maasai Mara through a lens of purpose and curiosity. You’ll leave with more than just photographs - you’ll carry a deeper understanding of the land, its people, and the wildlife that defines it

dayInfo.description: Your adventure begins with your arrival in Nairobi, where you’ll be met at the airport and transferred to Brackenhurst, a comfortable hotel nestled in tranquil surroundings. This first evening offers a chance to relax, meet fellow photographers, and prepare for the journey ahead.

After breakfast, we travel to the Pardamat Conservation Area, your base for the next few days. Once settled in, you’ll head out on your first game drive - an introduction to the landscapes and wildlife that will shape your photographic experience.

The next two days blend wildlife photography with hands-on conservation. You’ll explore the area with your camera while learning about local conservation efforts and how photography can support these initiatives.

Travel through the breathtaking landscapes of the Mara Triangle, a region renowned for its rich wildlife and dramatic scenery. En route to Eluai Campsite (your home for the next two nights) you’ll enjoy a game drive that introduces you to the area’s diverse animal life. Set above the Mara River, this open, unfenced campsite immerses you in the rhythms of the wild, where the sounds of the night bring the bush to life. As the day fades, venture out on an evening game drive with a focus on predator activity, timed to capture the golden light and peak movement. Enjoy a full day in the reserve on day six.

Begin the day with a sunrise game drive through the Mara Triangle, where the early light brings the landscape and its wildlife to life in striking detail. After capturing the morning’s activity, return to the Wildlife Tourism College for a midday break. Later, head back into the Pardamat Conservation Area for an evening game drive, rounding off the day with fresh sightings and a renewed appreciation for the region’s ecological diversity.

Journey into the heart of Mara Naboisho Conservancy and settle into Saruni Wilderness Camp, a secluded eco-retreat surrounded by untouched wilderness. This region is celebrated for its thriving predator populations and offers exceptional opportunities to photograph wildlife in a peaceful, minimally disturbed setting. With restricted vehicle access, you’ll benefit from exclusive sightings and uninterrupted time in the field. Between game drives, unwind at camp or take part in conservation efforts such as habitat restoration, camera trap monitoring, or wildlife counts - adding depth and purpose to your photographic experience.

Enjoy a final sunrise game drive through the tranquil landscapes of Naboisho, capturing the early light as the bush comes to life one last time. After returning to the Wildlife Tourism College, take time to reflect on the week’s journey, - sharing your favorite moments, images, and stories with fellow travelers as the experience draws to a close.
After breakfast, transfer back to Nairobi for your international flight.

tourName: Masai Mara & Amboseli safari in Kenya
generalInfo:
The Masai Mara Nature Reserve forms part of one of the most incredible and well known ecosystems in the world. Spreading south into Tanzania and the neighbouring Serengeti National Park the rolling plains are home to some of the largest numbers of animals on the planet.

This safari holiday takes you into the heart of the Mara and on the trail of Africa’s famous big five and much much more. Kenya is without a doubt the most wildlife watching and safari destination in the world and rightly so. With millions of individual animals living in the wide and largely open spaces, seeing nature on a grand scale is easier and more enjoyable here than anywhere else on earth.

From the Mara you will also visit the equally famous Amboseli, whilst the name may not be as famous as the Mara the iconic image of impressive mount Kilimanjaro rising above the plains is one of the most iconic images of East Africa and it is here where you can experience it.

So join us on this two destination safari holiday to Kenya and experience the wild majesty of the Mara and Amboseli in all of their glory.

Introduction:

We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of wildlife tours in Kenya which combine various different wildlife watching activities. In order to develop our unrivalled range of combined wildlife watching holidays, our guides and colleagues around the world have spent years searching out the world’s best wildlife watching locations as well as visiting some seldom visited areas. This dedication has led us to create this comprehensive safari which visits nearly all of the important wildlife watching locations within Kenya.

By visiting the grassland / savanna ecosystems of Masai Mara and Amboseli you will combine the famous wildlife watching destinations with some of the lesser visited in Kenya. By visiting more than one protected area you will gain a larger appreciation for ecotourism and conservation matters, which is what makes this safari unique.

All of our tours are guided by our own professional zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) so you are sure to be in the best hands possible for the best sightings as well as a great network of local guides in East Africa who have developed a great range of wildlife watching locations where the rarest species are commonly seen. Also to try and make sure that we will see as many of the rarer and elusive animals such as cheetah as well as the famous Big Five in the Mara & Ambsoeli. On this trip we will spend many hours during the early morning and late afternoon on jeep safaris and also (where possible) after dark each night we will head out with high powered spotlights and start the search for nocturnal species (where this is possible).

One of the reasons why our wildlife watching holidays are unique is that our background (as a company) is from a scientific and zoological standpoint and so have a great network of colleagues and contacts all over the world who are the people on the front line in search of the best new locations for wildlife watching. All of these reasons and many more make us experts in arranging safaris and are able to tailor a safari to any location to try to find your targeted species. All you have to do is to get in touch with your budget and your group size and where you would like to go to try and find rare and elusive species.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner (where mentioned in the itinerary)). There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned 4x4 vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers and open top 4x4 vehicles for all safaris. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) will escort you on all your excursions and also very knowledgeable English speaking local guides who have decades of experience working and guiding throughout Eastern Africa. Your zoologist (- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) escort is an expert in mammal biology and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge of where some of the most elusive African animals are; as well as having years of experience in bringing people out to see Africa’s big five and its hundreds of other species safely. We also include all vehicle safaris, guided walks, spotlighting drives, cultural performances, cultural activities, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the African bush or some other wildlife watching activity. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour.

Seasons:

We recommend September / October as a great time for this trip as the wildlife is abundant at this time of year and the weather is not too hot and drier than other times of year. But we can run the trip at other times of year; just note that the price quoted here is based on the low season, we can and do run this tour at other times of year, the wildebeest migration can also be included, please ask for specific quotes for different times of the year.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by a zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) as well as local naturalist guides, drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• We can offer you spotlighting trips around some of the places visited on the trip - where the local authorities allow after dark activities.
• We can also bring thermal imaging and night vision equipment as well as spotting scopes (on request) to also aid in finding the nocturnal mammals after dark and scan the horizon for harder to see species.
• We use camera traps (where available) which will increase the chances of getting close up pictures and movies of rare animals and other rare nocturnal wildlife.
• Explore a huge ranger of ecosystems and protected areas across two of the world's greatest wildlife watching destinations.
• Immerse yourself into the wonderful life of the Maasai and see how their famous coloured beads are made and also see how they and their cattle interact and live alongside the wildlife of the African plains and valleys.
• All the above reasons give this East African safari holiday a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here.
• We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout Eastern Africa so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the Big Five, gorillas, chimpanzees and hundreds of other species throughout Eastern Africa. Whether it is the Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda or Rwanda or any of the other many wildlife watching locations you want to visit we can arrange it. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour travels to two locations, firstly the wonderful Masai Mara National Nature Reserve and then both Amboseli National Parks (they adjoin each other) and the entrance and exit point for this trip is Nairobi.

Fitness Level:

The majority of wildlife watching is all done from the 4x4 safari vehicle so any fitness level can participate. There are very few walks involved and all do not require any special physical fitness.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old.

dayInfo.description: Nairobi - Arrival On your arrival into Nairobi airport you will be met by your local guide and driver and taken to your accommodation on the edge of this large city. If your arrival flight is early enough we can make it to the Mara today, otherwise it will be an early start for us to get to the Mara tomorrow. (no meals included today).

Masai Mara National Reserve - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning after an early breakfast at the hotel your guide will begin the journey southwest towards the border with Tanzania and the vast wild plains of the Maasi Mara / Serengeti ecosystem (~5 hours). The Masai Mara National Reserve is arguably the most famous wildlife watching destination in the world and home to some of the world’s most spectacular wildlife. As with the vast majority of wildlife around the world it is the early mornings and late afternoons which are the best for wildlife watching and so as the sun begins to get lower in the sky we will have the best chance of seeing lions and leopards. The reserve should still be playing (during September / October) host to around 1.7 million blue wildebeest, 260,000 plains zebra and 470,000 Thompson’s gazelles as they are at the end of their migration and spend the dry season in the Mara. Today will be more of a brief introduction to the Mara and we will be opportunistically trying and see anything of interest at the various waterholes and known locations for targeted species. (all meals included today)

Amboseli National Park - Travelling & Wildlife Watching This morning after breakfast we will leave the Mara and start our journey eastwards across the country. First we will head back north-east toward Nairobi where we will pickup the highway and head due east. Our next destination will come into view long before we are due to reach there as the iconic and imposing Mt. Kilimanjaro looms large out of the haze and begins to dominate the horizon. The mountain itself is over the border in Tanzania but the shadow it casts falls over the next park on our trip, Amboseli. We will arrive at the lodge and have the rest of the day to rest after the long journey getting here. (breakfast and dinner will be included today).

Nairobi - Travelling Today we will depart Amboseli after breakfast and drive back north-west to the capital and your hotel for the night. The rest of the day is free for you to relax and prepare for your departure tomorrow. (breakfast is the only meal included today).
Home - Departure After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. (breakfast is the only meal included today)

tourName: Masai Mara & Arabuko Forest safari in Kenya
generalInfo:
Kenya is the birthplace of all safaris and in particular the wonderful Masai Mara Reserve is the pinnacle of wildlife watching. This trip visits one of the best known wildlife locations and also one of the least visited. From the Masai Mara and its abundance of wildlife this trip then heads to one of the last remnant stands of East African Coastal Rainforest at Arabuko Sokoke Forest National Park.

By visiting these two very different places you should see a varied amount of African wildlife. As with the little known and seldom visited park of Arabuko Sokoke a whole host of different species (some of which are only found in this forest) can be seen with luck. On this trip we aim to see both the common and well known Kenyan wildlife as well as the little known and more elusive species, overall giving a great overview of various species in this wonderful safari destination.

So join us on this two destination safari holiday to Kenya and experience the wild majesty of the Mara and Arabuko Sokoke Forest in all of their glory.
